meranaw_proverb: Royo’on bo i mata na mithangkapa siran den sa ironotan sa gagaw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sobo so kiyaphagilaya o mata na miyakasinabotadn.
english_translation: With the contact of their eyes they were drawn in affectionate desire
interpretation: When their eyes met, a strong, tender longing or romantic attraction arose between them.

meranaw_proverb: Kalapisan ngka waka ka malengga ka man a taw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Kiyalapisan sekaniyan ka da pakisinabota ngegagaan.
english_translation: You were replaced waka because you are slow
interpretation: You got replaced, waka — took too long to make a move.

meranaw_proverb: Aya bo penayaon a rominarinaw so ig na masokat a layagen na botawanen so lansa
literal_translation_meranaw: Ayabo penayawn a makasisinabota siran ka-an siran makapanik.
english_translation: We will wait when the water is calm then we will sail.
interpretation: Let’s be patient and wait for the right time, when everything is stable and peaceful, then we’ll move forward together in our relationship.

meranaw_proverb: Ba ako mambo pandi A o makaborod ko laod na ipagoman a bantog o kalangowan iyo tanan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba ako mambo pandi a makatinedeg sa laod na kabantogan kano ron
english_translation: Am I a flag, which when flown in your place will add pride and dignity to everybody?
interpretation: Do you see me as someone worthy enough to represent you — to bring dignity by your side?

meranaw_proverb: Ino pen di saeyaten imosala komokopor a ino pen komokopor ka makababalebegen.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino kano pen di panik ka ino kapn raransan ka aden a gaga niyo.
english_translation: Why not keep in open the arrogant handkerchief? It might be arrogant because it can really afford.
interpretation: Why not give the proud guy a chance? Maybe he acts that way because he can actually back it up.

meranaw_proverb: San bo sa minagirid ko karodan a mawatan na da sa minidayonan ko ragat a pembataesen.
literal_translation_meranaw: Siibo sa katharo na da a moayaniyan.
english_translation: He is there off-shore looking at the faraway sea, But not proceeding to sail and cross the real sea.
interpretation: He sees the beauty and promise of love (or marriage) from afar, but lacks the courage or readiness to take the journey and truly pursue it.

meranaw_proverb:
O tanto ka paginged sa Gandamato Damedag na bangoni ngka sa pandi ka an langkap sa ranao a miyapasad a malang so saromagaw ko 
ringka.
literal_translation_meranaw: Otanto ka pangaroma na panoksam ka ka an langkap ko inged a myasapad ka.
english_translation:
If really you will live in the prestigious place then erect on it a flag for this will publicly announce 
throughout the Ranao the bethrothal of the lady of the palace
interpretation:
If you truly intend to marry her, then you must court her properly, seek her family's blessing, and make a public announcement. This will show everyone,
that you are serious about your intentions to wed with the lady.

meranaw_proverb: Somasana so ikan ka tig iyan a rek iyan so kalalangkoman iyan, takinoba ka kena, ka laod on so letingan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Somasana so tao(mangoda) ka tigyan a skanyan e phakataros mga Roma ko bae a pagidaan iyan takinoba bes ka kna.
english_translation:
Confident is the Ikan that he owns what he has but this is not so, he is far from him as 
the sky miles away like the sea.
interpretation: The confident boy thinks he's already got her, but he’s really just miles away, as distant as the sky is from the sea.

meranaw_proverb: Ino kon o di ako ko dowa repa binaning kay masowa aken ko sarepa mangondaya.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino Kon o di Ako ko malai daradat tomo a sii Ako ko miphagayon akn.
english_translation:
What will happen to me if I prefer a commoner wholely free as better as a nobleman with 
restraints twice more than a commoner.
interpretation:
What will happen if I choose a commoner, free from the constraints of nobility, over a nobleman who has even more restrictions than a commoner?
I would rather be with someone I can truly connect with.

meranaw_proverb:
Aya man a kandato na ibarat o kakhapal a polayagan sa akal na kalakalat so geda. Na panalongon so gagao na olinan so kawarao. 
Na pagabakan so gani na taros so Iman. Tiyotopan o pirak so kaiiisa o bangsa na likban o pelata so mona kanggiginawai. 
Na o tanto ka muslim na oba ka ki mabimban ko rambayong a kakal ka di kaon bo ketanto. Na obaka ki mabiray ko gadong a di lalayon 
ka di bo tanto kelanggay na magaan bo komelas.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Ayaman a kandato na pagosan sa akal ago geda geda na pagonaan sa gagao ago limo so pagtao. Phakaorin so 
kawarao na kenetan so gani na lalayonen ongo/syap ko pagtao. Osa imanto Aya na kyasapngan o perak o 
kathothonganaya ago so kanggiginawai. O tanto ka Muslim na obaka ki mabimban sa perak ka dibo khasanaan 
na magaambo malengan.
english_translation:
Leadership is like sailing a ship, which requires wisdom and skill. 
There must be kindness coupled with courage. Anger should be 
tamed and faith must be strengthened. It is not uncommon these 
days that money has become powerful than kinship and friendship,
 but if you are a true Muslim, then do not be dissuaded by money and
 worldly things for these are temporary and will soon fade.
interpretation:
The passage offers a reflection on leadership and life, emphasizing that effective leadership requires wisdom, kindness, courage, emotional control,
and a strong faith. It also reminds us not to be overwhelmed by the pursuit of money or material things, especially if they lead us away 
from meaningful connections and values. For a true Muslim, this world’s fleeting nature should not diminish the importance of faith and 
the relationships that really matter.

meranaw_proverb:
Na o ba kalipati so taritib ago sempad ka ayaden kasabapan a iphamagayao-ayao sa kalodan sa Mindanao na perigayan so palao sa 
da a tadem ko laod na ipelabas so orog so miaka mbalabala na o migadong so sempad na kanogon o phangampong ago so 
pephagampongon.
literal_translation_meranaw:
We must not forget cultural order and laws, for its negligence will cause turmoil on the sea of Mindanao while 
the mountains seem indifferent to the sea, and waves move loosely to and fro everywhere; if the laws are forgotten
 what will happen to our motherland and her inhabitants.
english_translation:
We must not forget the laws and rules in our culture, for its negligence may cause chaos that 
may lead to the loss of our motherland and its inhabitants.
interpretation:
A call for respect and adherence to cultural traditions and values. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining the foundations of one’s culture
in order to preserve the community and nation as a whole.

meranaw_proverb:
O sa imanto aya na sarombakat so bagul a dii makasonsanga ko kalodan o selangan na o di phorongi mantang a kisanggolay na lagi na
 pethimbangaros so ig na phangenepan so ragat na mataros a mabolos so panginam ko donya na ayaden khasabapan sa katarantana 
maog o pamoreg o bangnsa. Na mapatola mabengkas so kapenggiginawai na kanogon o marandang a go so pephagingedon ka aya 
khatamananon na sa di ron makakendan na maka pendinganoman ko oriayano kasendit
literal_translation_meranaw:
We are now faced with various challenges and opposing waves that strike us from all directions. If we are not
 careful and allow ourselves to be drowned in worldly things, we might sacrifice our kinship and love for each other. 
Truly, conflicts will arise and we will regret at the end.
english_translation:
We are now faced with various challenges and opposing waves 
that strike us from all directions. If we are not careful and allow
 ourselves to be drowned in worldly things, we might sacrifice our 
kinship and love for each other. Truly, conflicts will arise and we
 will regret at the end.
interpretation:
The speaker acknowledges that life is filled with difficulties, represented by "opposing waves" that come from all directions, symbolizing the 
various pressures, temptations, and conflicts we encounter. These challenges can distract us from what truly matters—our kinship, love,
and unity with others. The message warns that if we let ourselves get lost in material pursuits or external distractions, we might lose 
sight of our bonds with loved ones. Eventually, conflicts will arise, and we might regret not having prioritized our relationships and 
shared love over worldly matters.

meranaw_proverb: To ba lalan so korang na asar a pimbitakan
literal_translation_meranaw: Apiya ditano makowa so nganin tano na asar ka pinggalebek tano so miyagaga tano.
english_translation: Even if we fall short of what is expected, what is important is that we have done our best.
interpretation:
This emphasizes the value of effort over perfection. Leadership is about striving to do your best, even if you don’t always meet external expectations. 
What matters most is your dedication and commitment to giving your all, rather than the outcome alone.

meranaw_proverb: Na tomo den so kidalong a di so kipamalata.
literal_translation_meranaw: Masetomo so sikreto adi so pekhabinayar.
english_translation: Better to die than to lose one’s honor.
interpretation:
This expresses the idea that personal integrity and honor are more valuable than life itself. In leadership, maintaining respect, honor, and principles is
considered paramount, and losing one’s honor is seen as a fate worse than death.

meranaw_proverb: Saden sa mibasokan ka na aya ngka den map’ragon.
literal_translation_meranaw: Tonaa e piyamolangka na ayanga den mapragon.
english_translation: What you sow is what you reap.
interpretation:
This emphasizes the importance of actions and their consequences. Leaders who act with integrity, kindness, and wisdom will likely see positive 
outcomes, while those who act selfishly or dishonestly will face negative repercussions. It's a reminder that your actions shape your future.

meranaw_proverb: Di ka makapantaw ko pangkatan a maporo o ding ka kapanagadi so toto a maregen
literal_translation_meranaw: Dinga den maraot so pinakamaporo oda ka makasagad sa karumasayan.
english_translation: You will never reach the green spot of success unless you pass the hills of sacrifice.
interpretation:
Success doesn’t come without effort and sacrifice. Leadership requires perseverance through challenges and hardships. To achieve the rewards of 
success, one must be willing to sacrifice comfort, time, or resources to reach their goals.

meranaw_proverb:
So alongan ko palaw a mindomarenang kilat a salindaw a pheranti ko phimarandang a inged na so kiyasigay niyan sa probinsya 
ranon na ino pen da masawang e kipyapagayawayaw o layagen sa Sonoran ka ayaden so gaimpit e asal a pamagayan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Na amay pn ka madalmon anan.
english_translation: When one is good, it will be no surprise if he becomes a leader.
interpretation:
Leadership is earned through qualities like goodness, fairness, and wisdom. If someone consistently demonstrates positive traits, it is natural for them 
to be seen as a leader. Goodness in character and actions often naturally leads to leadership roles, as others will trust and respect them.

meranaw_proverb: Da mabilaw a taw o da a masarakanen.
literal_translation_meranaw: Daa makowa a mapya oda a panagontaman.
english_translation: No guts, no glory.
interpretation:
This emphasizes the need for courage in facing challenges. In conflict resolution, taking decisive action, standing up for what’s right, and being brave 
enough to address issues head-on is necessary to achieve meaningful outcomes. Without courage, there’s little chance for success or positive change.

meranaw_proverb: Aya betad a rido na pepaeganda andain ka mabalon bo a ridaw sa pekaelanggay a ridaw.
literal_translation_meranaw: So khaphapawala na kabegan sa oras a kapakalenggaw niyan ka sabenar a sa kapakaipos o oras na makanggiginawae bo.
english_translation: Conflict, if given a cooling off time, As time goes eventually Will be solved.
interpretation:
This speaks to the importance of allowing time and space in conflict resolution. Sometimes, stepping back and allowing emotions to cool can help resolve 
conflicts naturally over time. It suggests that patience and a calm perspective can eventually lead to solutions without escalating the issue.

meranaw_proverb: Palandong ko so rinaw na o peman o ba saleg na lebi a bantak aken.
literal_translation_meranaw: Kabaya aken so kalilintad ogaid na o pakhaowa so nganin a dita kathawan odina a dita kabaya na makakaiketiyar ako.
english_translation: I crave for peace But if trouble comes (not of my own will) Then I will be ready for it.
interpretation:
This reflects a desire for peace but also readiness to face challenges or conflict when necessary. It highlights that one should always strive for harmony but 
be prepared to confront conflict if it arises, especially if it’s imposed by external circumstances.

meranaw_proverb: Idadawag da rido na bariwanger maregen.
literal_translation_meranaw: Igira mipagoobayingka na mapya kaon atao na omakatalikod ka na marata kaon pman.
english_translation: The giving is apparently with no trouble, But covertly there is deep regret.
interpretation:
This statement refers to the idea that sometimes, offering help or assistance may seem effortless to others, but internally, the giver may experience regret 
or resentment. This could indicate the hidden emotional cost of actions or compromises made for the sake of peace or harmony, even 
if they appear simple on the surface.

meranaw_proverb: So sangibo a ranan na piatay o tademan.
literal_translation_meranaw: So madakl a galbk a mapya na pkhadaan sa Bali ko satiman a karibatan.
english_translation: All good deeds will be forgotten with a single mistake
interpretation:
This reflects the unfortunate reality that people often remember a single mistake more than a series of good actions. In the context of conflict resolution or 
leadership, one error can overshadow a history of positive deeds, emphasizing the need for careful decision-making and maintaining trust and integrity.

meranaw_proverb: Madabo so pezepot na somambi so tademan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Oba mada so kapagagos iyan, na pesendit sa oriyan.
english_translation: With the loss of power comes The loss of influence If not for good deeds.
interpretation:
This suggests that power and influence are fleeting unless they are built on a foundation of good deeds and genuine relationships. This could imply that 
people who use their power wisely and act with integrity can maintain influence, even after losing formal authority, whereas those who rely solely on their 
power may lose influence when their authority fades.

meranaw_proverb: Aya kaka sa lalag na so ago katiger.
literal_translation_meranaw: So pamimikiran o mga lokes na matiger.
english_translation: It is wiser to be patient and self controlled.
interpretation:
This encourages taking a calm, measured approach when dealing with conflict. Instead of reacting impulsively or emotionally, it’s wiser to practice patience 
and self-control. Emotional restraint helps avoid escalation and allows for clearer thinking and better decisions.

meranaw_proverb: So bawing a ketesen na amay bo ka ketesen na makathathaginesa.
literal_translation_meranaw: So bawing na aya ropaan iyan na badoten ron, na amay ka biyadot kawn na ba badn kailot so kikakabed iyan ko lopa.
english_translation: True strength lies in deep roots that resist being uprooted.
interpretation:
Real strength comes from having a solid foundation — whether it’s values, principles, or relationships. This can mean having a strong sense of self or 
strong support systems that help you stay grounded, even in the face of adversity. Strong roots help you withstand challenges without being easily swayed 
or "uprooted.

meranaw_proverb: Ding ka pezarayaten ko kadandan o madakel ka kepanen ko kanggaring ko kaisa-isa o bangsa.
literal_translation_meranaw: Banga tharo sa kalangkapan ka sabnar na maiilot so gagaw ago babaya ka'an maisaisa so bangsa.
english_translation: You are part of a larger clan, do not destroy the bond by giving them the same
interpretation:
This emphasizes the importance of unity and the collective good. It’s easy to retaliate or mirror negative behavior, but this statement advises against doing 
so. It encourages resolving conflicts in ways that preserve relationships and bonds, especially within families, teams, or communities. If you harm the group 
by mimicking bad behavior, you weaken the connection and trust.

meranaw_proverb: Baden malengga so ig na maoma o misabar.
literal_translation_meranaw: Oway ka malombat so ig, ogaid na matatangked a pakaoma ko angin iyan asar ka matao numayaw.
english_translation: Patience leads to rewards—good things come to those who wait.
interpretation:
This reinforces the idea that patience, especially in conflict situations, ultimately leads to positive outcomes. In conflict resolution, rushing into decisions or 
trying to force an outcome can often cause more harm than good. Taking the time to understand the situation, consider all perspectives, and allow things to 
unfold can lead to better, lasting results.

meranaw_proverb: Ba ino ko tinindeg so mamaan sa lawi-an ka ba aken phamanika, ino aken biyorod ka phagamas-amasen ko o benar a matilpa.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba ino aken pephamagidaana ka ba ko phangaromaa, dii aken khana-kanan ka phag-ilain ko o mapiya a mipshorot.
english_translation:
I am courting her, not necessarily with the intention of marrying her. I am only trying to sense 
her behavior if it is compatible with my behavior, in case I decide.
interpretation:
Courtship is seen here as a process of observation and discernment, not a binding commitment. The speaker is trying to assess compatibility, suggesting t
hat marriage should be based on mutual understanding rather than haste or pressure. It reflects a cautious and thoughtful approach to love.

meranaw_proverb: Awa ka san da’ thobaw ka di ka palandong a dar, na iseg ka da’ sharo-ar ka di ka bantak a siri.
literal_translation_meranaw: Hay bago a mama a da pen shinempek! Di ako ngka den pipikira ka kena o kala ka ipekha baya-i ko.
english_translation:
Vanish from here poor boy for you have no place in my heart (meaning, the woman does not 
find in him her ideal man)
interpretation:
This expresses a rejection rooted in standards or preferences. It reveals the woman's autonomy in choosing a partner, emphasizing that love or courtship is 
not simply about effort or persistence—it also depends on emotional and personal fit.

meranaw_proverb:
Ino ako di gampang ka di ako pendarapa ka maka bolog ta koris na 
ron ta on bo kharoshang.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino ako di madakel i kapamagidaan ka aya tindeg aken na tibolog bo a koris aken na aya ko den maphangaroma.
english_translation: I am not a teaser because I trust destiny should be meant for me at an appointed time.
interpretation:
The speaker distances themselves from casual or playful romantic intentions, trusting that true love will come at the right time. This reflects faith in fate or 
destiny, and a belief in sincere, purposeful relationships.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ka mbo-bolothow ago ka phapanayangan a di ka pen mbi-binentay ka an ka mapamagayaw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino ka manoronsorong a di ka mayag sa lalag ka salamaten ami seka.
english_translation:
What made you hesitant? Please propose it to us so we may welcome and make ourselves 
available to you.
interpretation:
This shows openness and receptivity from the family or woman’s side, possibly encouraging a suitor who is delaying his intentions. It emphasizes 
communication and suggests that a respectful, formal approach will be met with hospitality and consideration.

meranaw_proverb:
So palaw na miphalaw sa ishik a palaw niyan na ipag-isha ko aya o 
pira soson pira lad ka an kami ron di sawang a mapa-pangka kami 
ron.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Pakaisha ini o ina o babay… “So menang o miyakasowa ago mala i adat na ipagesa ami o 
bana kakekes o mahar iyan ka anami manggeda-geda o kalotang ami.
english_translation:
Career woman with a good family background is difficult to reach. Therefore, we are asking if her 
dowry can be negotiated so we will be encouraged to give her.
interpretation:
This reveals socioeconomic dynamics in courtship and marriage—especially in contexts where dowries or bride prices are still practiced. It acknowledges 
that a woman of high status may be seen as 'hard to reach' and introduces the idea of negotiating traditional expectations to make union more attainable.

meranaw_proverb:
Pamomolan ka den so pamomolan sa Ranaw na asar a ron bo 
taman a kasa-sapada ngka on na di ka malang sa koris.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Dii ngka den tharo-a a pagidaan ka sekaniyan na asar a roron bo taman na di ka bo mamaka 
alang ko ped a phangaroma a giyoto i tithow a koris a ngkai a warisan ami.
english_translation:
You may proudly declare her to be your darling, but your love cannot prevent her from meeting her 
fate as to whom she will marry.
interpretation:
This highlights the limits of romantic claims—that no matter how much one declares love, destiny or the woman’s ultimate choice may lead her elsewhere. 
It’s a reminder that love doesn’t guarantee marriage, and that fate or circumstances beyond one's control may prevail.

meranaw_proverb:
Ba ino ko kinowir ka ba ko tanto khowira, kinowi-kowir aken ka 
kinowir ako niyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Ba ino aken dii shasanda-sandagan sa di tanto ka ba adena pamikiran ko ron ka malo ko dii shandagan kagiya a 
pekasipatan aken.
english_translation:
I do not intend to treat her with any degree of seriousness simply because I caressed her. This is 
the reason I am so close to her, as she was the first to come close.
interpretation:
This expresses a lack of genuine romantic intention. The speaker clarifies that physical closeness does not mean emotional commitment—it’s simply a 
response to her initial interest. It serves as a warning: not all intimacy means sincerity.

meranaw_proverb:
An a linang bolawan a o di kapag-imani sa iman a samporna na 
maka dorat i lalag, na an matag sapo a margen a lipatan ka di ta 
niyan ndoraten.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden a mapiya a taw a o di ngka ka-iktiyari na phag-akalen ka niyan na aden peman a di tanto 
mapiya a taw a margen o ba ta kalipati ka di ta niyan phag-akalan.
english_translation:
There are nobles around but beware of them cheating you, while there are ignobles or 
commoners you cannot forget about their being loyal, sincere, and not deceptive.
interpretation:
This challenges social expectations by suggesting that status does not equal virtue. Nobility may come with hidden deceit, while commoners may offer 
genuine love and honesty. It promotes valuing character over social rank in choosing a life partner.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ako man di kerit ka palad ako komrit na panga-tatalokhaban.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino ako di pethanto ka o saken i mbinentay na di den pendorat na miya pangaroma ko.
english_translation: I do not propose because the moment I make my proposal (for marriage) I am certain to be accepted.
interpretation:
This statement could be read as confidence or caution. The speaker may feel assured of the woman’s acceptance, but delays proposing perhaps due to 
deeper considerations, such as readiness or timing. It implies that commitment is a serious step, not to be taken lightly.

meranaw_proverb: Thataman sa pintran so alambet a korikod
literal_translation_meranaw: Mithaman so khagaga ko -da den a shogotan pen o bager aken.
english_translation: I cannot do or give more than I can afford.
interpretation:
This shows honesty and humility. It acknowledges financial or emotional limitations, and the speaker refuses to overextend or make promises they can’t 
keep. In courtship or marriage, this is a plea for realistic expectations and sincerity.

meranaw_proverb:
Ba ko mbethowa oran so matag pekhi rapirik a mapay so tagawalay 
na da salangkapa o ig, aya mbethon a oran na domshang sa 
sadshang na lomiyangkap sa Ranaw.
literal_translation_meranaw:
So matag ba den bantaan na da a totogo niyan aya tithow a benar na miyaka mapayag sa lalag 
na kiya tokawan o mbala-bala ko phowaris
english_translation:
Do not expect so much when there is no assurance that the assumption is not good. 
However, a sincere proposal will be known to all close relatives.
interpretation:
This warns against building hopes on uncertain intentions. Unless there’s a clear, formal, and sincere proposal—especially one known and approved by 
family—it’s wise not to assume anything. It underscores the cultural value of family involvement in serious relationships.

meranaw_proverb:
Ba ta den phaka sayan ko papanok ko shagadan a kereken a 
tagamen a layamen pagakalan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aya kabebetadan raken na matag kasablawan a dii thatalo-talowan ka aya on den kaplayama ka sabap sa phag-akalen.
english_translation: I may be treated as a pet to be tamed for a hobby and pastime, only to realize that I was deceived.
interpretation:
This reflects emotional betrayal. The speaker feels they may be used or led on, only to later find that the affection was not genuine. It serves as a caution 
against being toyed with emotionally, especially in one-sided or playful courtships.

meranaw_proverb:
Mapiya pen sotra i tataman sa leb aken, na thomo on ko so kindang 
a miphanali-kombong ko.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya pen mapiya a taw i mapangaroma ko a di ako niyan bo matingki (ko adat ago parangay), 
na thomoon aken den so koma-kalilid a taw amiphangangarig aken (so kapiya niyan i adat-parangay).
english_translation:
Being a member of royalty is insufficient reason for a lady to be accepted into a marriage. It is best 
to choose an everyday man who is responsible and capable of providing for his family.
interpretation:
Status doesn’t guarantee suitability. Practicality, character, and the ability to provide outweigh noble birth. The proverb critiques shallow criteria in choosing 
a spouse, promoting values-based partnership over prestige.

meranaw_proverb:
Mapiya anda phoon i bagiyo a lengaleng na di ko paka ondasen ka 
balawagan ko sa gas na bonsodan ko sa itil.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya anda den phaka poon so phangalang raken na pagrenen aken.
english_translation: I shall remove any impediments in my path by building stumbling stones in his path.
interpretation:
This shows competitive or spiteful intent in love or rivalry. It implies one may sabotage a rival in courtship just to advance their own chances—reflecting 
themes of jealousy or aggressive pursuit in love.

meranaw_proverb: Bilang a taw so dato o maonda so pemba-i.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya so mama o mapiya so babay a darodopa.
english_translation: The man, or husband, should be a good man if the woman, or wife, is a good woman.
interpretation:
This emphasizes balance and moral compatibility. A good woman deserves a good man. It promotes equal responsibility and character matching in a 
marriage.

meranaw_proverb: Ba gopen a taw si mandar ka o sabapen sa isa.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba di ako den mawiyag o di misabap sa isa taw.
english_translation:
I can only succeed and live if I am not dependent on anyone. I trust Allah and myself 
more than anyone else!
interpretation:
This shows self-reliance and spiritual trust. In marriage or courtship, it reflects the speaker’s belief in not being reliant on others for their worth or success—
possibly as a response to failed relationships or expectations.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den rangkap so takil a ika-sarampong iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba den ped ko kambata-bataa a maka didiyabo ron.
english_translation:
What is the use of becoming a member of a family, group, or community when one may only 
bring chaos and disorder?
interpretation:
This reflects concern for harmony and peace. It warns against choosing a partner (or joining a union) if one only contributes negativity or division—
marriage is about building, not breaking.

meranaw_proverb: Koma-kasar di ngganding si romi-rindong powisan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Pephangabaya na di niyan bo phayagen, na so kapephagma iyan na kiya lapisan.
english_translation: You may be silently in love, and your silence has made you supplant.
interpretation:
Unspoken love leads to missed chances. The speaker regrets staying silent, letting someone else take their place. A warning: If you love, say it before it’s 
too late.

meranaw_proverb: Katombar so madakel na loya so sasatiman.
literal_translation_meranaw: Baden aki madakel so mama, na aya bo tanto mama.
english_translation: There are lot of men, but only one of them is the real man (capable and doer of good work).
interpretation: Quality over quantity in potential partners. A real man is not just male by gender, but by responsibility, action, and integrity.

meranaw_proverb: O mbes o ba so di ngka na di ka mindatomanong.
literal_translation_meranaw: Opama ka so di ngka pekha babayaan na aya ngka makowa odi na mapangaroma na di ka miyaka kowa sa mimbatowa.
english_translation: If only you got what you did not expect, then it would be far better.
interpretation: Unexpected blessings in love are often the most genuine. Sometimes, the person or outcome you didn’t plan for turns out to be the most fulfilling.

meranaw_proverb: Ita-tangkap ka den a papanok ka so nori a mapay so samber iyan na da ngka ra-ota sengaw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Tatarimaan ka den a pagidaan ka sekaniyan a da den ma-aros o ba ngka mimbitiyara-i.
english_translation:
You are certain that you have been loving her, when you have not even proposed to her your love 
(not even talk to her because of shyness).
interpretation: Love must be expressed, not hidden. This criticizes passive admiration—loving from afar doesn’t count if it isn’t communicated.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ko peranona i diyalendeg a pakal a an a bonsalo iyan a da a kipantag iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino aken ay phangabaya-i i aden a pa-awing iyan.
english_translation: Why should I love and court her when she is useless and her character is tainted?
interpretation:
Character is central in choosing a partner. The speaker refuses to pursue someone they believe lacks virtue. It reflects moral standards and the value of a 
good reputation.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ko di thangkeda a papanok ko so nori a mapiya anda ndapo na kasa-sampirotan ko.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino aken dii tharo-a a pagidaan aken ka mapiya antona-a den i manggolaola na mao-ona ko den ko poso iyan.
english_translation:
Why should I not be certain of her being mine? For no matter what, I am in the chamber of her 
heart (meaning, she loves him very much).
interpretation:
This reflects confidence in mutual love. The speaker is certain of the woman’s feelings, even without public commitment. It’s about emotional security and 
trust in her affection.

meranaw_proverb: Ino kon ari sa imboko i da ta sa pikir iyan nago sa ipagotantang i da ta ko darem iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino aken raranona ago miya awid a akal i di ta niyan khabayaan.
english_translation: Why would I get worried and care, she doesn't love me
interpretation: The speaker is asserting emotional detachment, possibly masking pain. It’s a declaration of moving on from unreciprocated love.

meranaw_proverb: Mada' bo so pesepot na somambi so tadman.
literal_translation_meranaw: Malngan ka bo anan na khato-osan ko so tadman ka raken a mapiya ka mapendingan-dingan ka bo.
english_translation:
When all the things in you are spent, that is when you will remember the goodness that I have 
given you.
interpretation:
This speaks of unappreciated love. The speaker warns that once the listener’s pleasures or options are gone, they will remember the one who truly cared 
for them. It's a reflection of taken-for-granted affection.

meranaw_proverb: Kariray o miyanik na kaya ko piyanikan
literal_translation_meranaw: Pekha mamala so miyanganakan na pekhaya mambo so piyanganakanan
english_translation: Both the pursuing man and the courted woman show shyness.
interpretation:
This shows mutual awkwardness or restraint in traditional courtship. It highlights the modesty or hesitation typical in early stages of love, where neither 
party is bold enough to act fully.

meranaw_proverb: Karam o tantangi ko so an a motantang ko ron.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di aken den geneken so taw a pekha bayaan aken.
english_translation: I cannot stop her, for she has my love for her.
interpretation:
Even if the woman leaves or does something unexpected, the speaker cannot resent her because of deep love. It’s a passive but loyal expression of 
emotional surrender.

meranaw_proverb: Da layag si layagen ka liyayag o layagen
literal_translation_meranaw: Da ako panganakan ka saken i piyanganakanan.
english_translation: I did not say it (my love for her), but it was them who were intimate.
interpretation:
This may refer to emotional or physical closeness happening between others, while the speaker loved silently. It suggests jealousy, regret, or frustration 
over lost chances due to unspoken feelings.

meranaw_proverb: Di ako phaki indig ka o ka-indigi ako na manok ako a layam a maka rarangkirba.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di ngka raken anan pagraren ka saken na mambo na maka lalalonga ako.
english_translation: Don’t provoke me with your deceit because I do not provoke, for when I provoke, I am a deceiver.
interpretation:
This is a warning about trust and betrayal. The speaker declares their honesty but implies they are capable of deceit if pushed—revealing a vulnerable 
threshold between love and retaliation.

meranaw_proverb: Da a mabilaw a taw o da a matawakalen.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di khakowa mapiya so taw a di masarakanen
english_translation: No one can prosper and make progress in life unless he/she has courage.
interpretation: While general, in courtship it urges one to be brave in expressing love, proposing, or committing. Love (and life) requires stepping out of comfort zones.

meranaw_proverb: Pag-ingati ngka ramig so phikandiri ngka lalag a miya nget a pandapat ka o di pag-onganeni na kiropa sa di tangkap.
literal_translation_meranaw: Phiyapiyai ngka so ba ngka bo katharo ka raranan a ikha-pitas ka
english_translation:
Take caution with what you say, as it may result in your failure to accomplish what you set out to 
do.
interpretation:
This emphasizes tact and thoughtfulness in communication during courtship. A wrong word or careless statement can ruin one’s chances in love or 
marriage.

meranaw_proverb: Kalopindo perarem a pendapo sa bo-ongan na madiyadi ka phayag ka bethowan ka sa ngaran.
literal_translation_meranaw: Hay! manganganakan ino ka baden di phaki tokaw ka an ami katokawi o pethanto ka.
english_translation:
Gentleman, why don’t you say or express what you have in mind for us to conclude that you are 
determined.
interpretation:
A call for clarity and honesty. The speaker (possibly a woman or her family) demands clear intentions—don’t lead someone on or stay silent. If you mean it, 
declare it boldly.

meranaw_proverb: Ba aden ari a pikhilatan a ba da a palaw niyan sa kandadamdag iyan ko kaphag-odayaw o ig.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba aden a mangangaroma a ba da a tamok iyan.
english_translation:
Is there anybody who declare to marry without a Dowry (Money and other assets required for 
marriage)?
interpretation:
Marriage is not just about love—it involves tradition, responsibility, and material readiness. The dowry here symbolizes a family's preparedness and respect 
for custom.

meranaw_proverb:
Anda i tompok a libon a omban-omban a baning a tamlang binarisan, na ba niyo den payaga i mborodan on sa ranon ka amay 
ka masino ta a makawanan so ponay na madiyowang so legawan na man oto tano nggibas ka tomarokon kami ron a pat gatos miyorod.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Anda i kaphayag ka sa lalag a di ngka pen paka balsen ka amay ka ba alo-alo bo ka di benar so 
tothol na an tano maka mbla-belag ka ayami den onotan a pamikiran a pat a shak-sakeb sa ngkai a 
warisan ami.
english_translation:
When are you going to declare your intention not to prolong the agony? If you are joking, you 
may part away and we will join you and part away too.
interpretation:
This urges clarity and seriousness in courtship. Love should not be toyed with; if intentions are insincere, then both sides should walk away rather than 
suffer emotional uncertainty.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ko di tangkeda a kawali ko so sapad a mapiya anda tampar na pagalad ako niyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Ino aken di tatarimaa a pagidaan aken i mapiya anda song na paka o-onoten ako niyan odi na 
mapiya anda dingil na pekailay ako niyan.
english_translation:
Why should I doubt that she is my love when she invites me to accompany her wherever she 
goes and her gaze is always on me?
interpretation: Actions speak louder than words—her affectionate gestures and consistent presence give him confidence in her love, removing all doubts.

meranaw_proverb: O tanto ka phag-inged sa Guindolongan Marogong na bangoni ngka sa pandi ka payongan ko seka on sa bolawan datomanong.
literal_translation_meranaw: O baka phangaroma na payag kano sa lalag ka salamaten ami seka.
english_translation:
If you decide to live with us in this community through marriage, then let it be known so we may 
extend our warmest welcome.
interpretation:
Marriage is viewed not just as a union between individuals but as a bond between families and communities. Openly declaring intentions allows for 
acceptance, celebration, and preparation.

meranaw_proverb:
Gowani ko ba den tig so khi-talingoma masa ko mosim a songgod a ig na antara so madakel, nago mbales so maana na kiya 
tokawan o taw a an a pendiyamongen a isa bo sa pompongan na di ta ipangangandam sa ba di ondas sa rinaw ka domaramba si 
mirag na mapiya maka sonsang sa bagiyo a marodo na di den mbaroba maog ka miya patri saleg o lalawo' a da mada', na o 
katig si maranday na minsan maka sagansang sa latasan o bagiyo na di pharin pekhoyakas ka pekha kembang salindaw o tolos a da 
marendan, na aya lalag aken on na dara-an shidan tano a kaplabo o masa ko kapembetadan iyan a lalag o Simban a taw.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Sii ko paganay a matag baden bantaan a aden a phaka talingoma na mapephangantok a pamikiran, 
na so kiya paka talingoma iran na kiya tokawan a den bes a paka pethapi-in a isa bo sa bangensa, na 
di ta ika-awan ka o pagayon-ayon so manga lolot ago so manga dato, na mapiya i awid a akal on na 
khada' -aya sabap iyan na kagiya maka ookit ko katho-tonganaya ago so kaisai-isa ko bangensa-na 
ilain tano den i kakha-samporna iyan
english_translation:
We have just stories of intent to begin with, and we will not make any assumptions. When they 
arrive, we know that there will be nobles who will unite through marriage, and we need not be 
concerned that this will not happen provided all of their families and leaders extend harmonious 
support—so that any issue or hindrance will be removed. As a result, let us wait and see when it 
will be completed.
interpretation:
This reflects cultural diplomacy and patience. The community refrains from assumptions until proper declarations and family consent are given. Unity and 
harmony among families are vital for marriage to proceed smoothly.

meranaw_proverb:
Gowani ko ba den tig so khi-talingoma masa ko mosim a songgod a ig na antara so madakel, nago mbales so maana na kiya tokawan o 
taw a an a pendiyamongen a isa bo sa pompongan na di ta ipangangandam sa ba di ondas sa rinaw ka domaramba si mirag na 
mapiya maka sonsang sa bagiyo a marodo na di den mbaroba maog ka miya patri saleg o lalawo' a da mada', na o katig si maranday 
na minsan maka sagansang sa latasan o bagiyo na di pharin pekhoyakas ka pekha kembang salindaw o tolos a da marendan, 
na aya lalag aken on na dara-an shidan tano a kaplabo o masa ko kapembetadan iyan a lalag o Simban a taw.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Miya payag ago miyaka liwanag so lalag na kiya tokawan, na so den so kiya paka pemamasa-i ko 
kalilimod a da a ba on awid a akal ka kiya tokawan a giya ngkai a mangangaroma na phoon a 
bangensa ko tingki a ngkai a phamala-iyan na miya satiman so tindeg na baanda siran maka 
pethatarosa.
english_translation:
Obviously, we are told that we will be able to witness this peaceful event and that there will be 
no obstructions. Since the bride is from a well-known family, equally sharing the same nobility, 
prestige, and honor with the family of the bridegroom, we are unanimous that it shall soon be 
materialized.
interpretation:
A formal and optimistic view on a prestigious marriage alliance, emphasizing equality in family background and status. The path is seen as smooth due to 
mutual respect and readiness.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i alongan shidan a kilakiten ki ladan ka an kami ron di sawang.
literal_translation_meranaw: Anda i kaphanoksam iyo ka an kami di kadadarai.
english_translation: When are you planning to make your proposal? So we may not be curious while waiting
interpretation:
An invitation for clear communication and decisive action. The speaker encourages the suitor to act soon to avoid dragging the situation and causing 
unnecessary speculation or emotional strain.

meranaw_proverb:
So sagorompong a bok na kowa ka on sa isa na di khatod a igakot, na o maka mbabi-babid na phaka ren sa barko – na so tarintik a 
oran na di niyan khawasaan so tomi-timbok a pethad, na igira miya timo na mag-ondas na bagiyo.
literal_translation_meranaw: So kapamagogopa na o masagom-parak a matabis so sakataw na di phaka ren, na so kai-isaisa bager.
english_translation: There is power in togetherness, and there is failure in separation.
interpretation:
Unity brings strength, especially in leadership and governance. Division weakens a community, a family, or even a royal house. This is a foundational 
principle in traditional Meranaw society.

meranaw_proverb:
Kanogon o Unayan a ba den kiya sagadan o lalaog a da mada' na nogon o madalendeg a ba den siyarigidan o tolos a da marendan na 
katii so Bayabao a kiya sampornaan ko tihaya maka ombaw a ini ombaw a manis o Ranaw a rangka manis.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Giya kon a Unayan na matag on somiyagad so Mapiya ago kiyasariyatan, giya Bayabao na ron 
miyangimpoon so menang ago so kiyatagumpiya a Ranaw.
english_translation:
It is indeed unfortunate that Unayan is only a small percentage of Ranaw's people, whereas 
Bayabao is the source of the people who made Ranaw a magnificent nation.
interpretation:
This reflects an acknowledgment of demographic reality and historical pride—Unayan is smaller, while Bayabao contributed more prominently to the 
greatness of Ranaw. It hints at genealogical roots and pride in lineage.

meranaw_proverb: Mapay pen sa pelabi ko talentak o Taraka nago sa pendalomabi I tanan on samporna.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di kano aki dii mbologan sa katharo sa ba niyo kalawani a Taraka (Masiu) ka ron kano maa-amor a manga taw sa Ranaw.
english_translation: Taraka (Masiu) is where Masiu comes from, so don't talk too much in advance.
interpretation:
A reminder to show respect for origins and refrain from speaking boastfully, especially when in the presence of or about historical places like Taraka and 
Masiu, which hold ancestral and political significance.

meranaw_proverb: Paganay a mbekasen so olaola kandato na taritiba ngka so taw na kompasa ngka so inged.
literal_translation_meranaw: Paganay a penggolaolaan ka ko kiya dato ka na tatanora ngka so madakel a taw ago tataritiba ngka so inged.
english_translation: As a leader, the first thing you will do is manage the people and organize the community
interpretation:
Effective leadership begins with people management and community organization. This statement prioritizes governance and civil order as fundamental 
duties of any enthroned leader.

meranaw_proverb: Idagsha so lama na tanoren so paso-ay
literal_translation_meranaw: Deshaan ka so torogan (lama-lama o dato) na lilimpiyowa ngka so manga lalan san ko manga rarata a ongar.
english_translation:
Make the streets clean and organize the people so that they can work better together. Sanitize the 
streets of the people who have broken the law. This would also mean that the office (torogan) 
would be properly set up and that the people would be organized so that other tasks and 
responsibilities could be delegated to them.
interpretation:
A metaphorical and literal call for clean governance. The “cleaning of streets” symbolizes restoring public order and moral authority. The torogan (royal
house) is seen as a seat of leadership that must be run efficiently and justly.

meranaw_proverb: Da kawanan da ramig, na da diyowang da pagari
literal_translation_meranaw: Oba ka dii shoramig sa lolot-mapiya lolot ka i phanganiyaya na began ka so kabnar ko taw a kha-aniyaya.
english_translation: Be fair without nepotism. Judge the people according to your fair judgment without bias.
interpretation: This advocates for just leadership, free from favoritism. A good leader should base decisions on truth and fairness, not family ties or power dynamics.

meranaw_proverb:
Na mapiya mata-tangked a maono-ay so delem a thatagoma so robas, na o an maneg ka a pekhasawalan sa tig na barabadan so 
lalan na pephanalani ngka den.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Na mapiya madalem a gawii nago aden a kha-ontaling ka a dii phapawala, na pamarabadi ngka 
so lalan na songwi ngka, di ngka penayawaa kasongwan ka iran.
english_translation:
When conflict arises, even during the darkest night, use a torch and go to the place where the 
conflict happened, and never wait until the people inform you of such a conflict.
interpretation:
True leadership is proactive. One must act decisively in resolving disputes, rather than being passive or waiting for problems to be reported. The "torch" 
symbolizes wisdom, vigilance, and courage.

meranaw_proverb:
Marawraw so Tebok a dibaloy a Malabang a bagabay a Silungan a rimbang a Maguindanao a pimbekenan o Anta a miyangombaw i 
bantog ko sapasagi ko ragat. (Pananaroon o Anta sa Tubok)
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya i paras a Tubok ka lagid a Malabang a tingki a Silungan sa Maguindanao a piyaginetawan 
o Anta a kiya dayo-an a bangensa ko saopak ko peragatan.
english_translation:
Tubok is beautiful, just like Malabang and Silungan in Maguindanao, where the ambilineal of 
Anta is based and is known all over the other side of the sea.
interpretation:
This praises certain places and their ancestral heritage—particularly Tubok, Malabang, and Silungan. It also references ambilineal descent, suggesting 
prestige and fame that reaches even beyond local shores.

meranaw_proverb:
Boklod a minombaw a man so naga somalong a kini pantaw a Pikong a mithalikop i bantog ka sabapan den ko Nago a ino 
mirangka-lawan ka da ma-ako sawalen o taw ko linding o Ranaw ka tanan iyan bangensa. (Pananaroon o Nago sa Pikong)
literal_translation_meranaw:
Maka oombaw a Pikong a loma-langkap so bantogan iyan ka sabap den ko Nago a ino 
mithagodaya ka di kha-kelo o taw sa Ranaw ka kagiya palaya iyan bangensa.
english_translation:
It's like a dragon: Pikong is famous because of Nago, who stands out. In fact, the people of Ranaw 
have never been able to get it because they all have the same ancestor.
interpretation:
A poetic expression of clan prestige and individual distinction. Even in a society with common ancestry (like Ranaw), certain names (like Nago of Pikong) 
still rise and are remembered—like a dragon among men.

meranaw_proverb:
Makoranda so Butig a lomiyabaw Marogong a maona katpadan o lalaog a da' mada a ini ombaw a manis o Madalendeg Anonen ka 
aya bo pirogongan ka sabapan ko Asiyah a Paramata sa Butig. (Pananaroon o Asiyah sa Butig)
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya i paras a Butig a ini pangombaw a Marogong (Unayan) a aya kiya poonan o bangensa 
a kiya paka ombaw niyan ka kagiya so Asiyah sii sa Butig.
english_translation:
Butig is beautiful, making Marogong Madalendeg unconquered and ahead—the very 
first place where people originated because of Asiyah.
interpretation:
This references sacred genealogical history. Butig, a revered place, is seen as the origin of peoples through a key ancestor named Asiyah, and Marogong 
Madalendeg is portrayed as unconquered and proud.

meranaw_proverb:
Marandang a bantayan a Maorintang Anonen a sindigan a Taraka a abay a Samporna ka nanao sa Maganding a mona kiya 
sengko-an o daradiyat a langkap a kormat a lalayon ko Oray Pindawadawa sa Arkata Masiu. (Pananaroon o Pindawadawa Oray sa Masiu)
literal_translation_meranaw:
Tanto a matanos a Maorintang Anonen a kapapadalman sa Taraka a tingki a Samporna 
sabap sa giya Maganding na ron paganay a maka sengko so monapona a basalen a ka daradiyat a 
ini pelila-lilang ko Pindawadawa Oray sa Masiu.
english_translation:
When the first kolintang was played in Maganding, it sounded like Masiu's Pindawa-dawa 
Oray. This makes Maorintang Anonen, where Taraka is, a good place to live.
interpretation:
A symbolic blending of music, culture, and geography. The kolintang, a traditional musical instrument, represents heritage. The comparison ties places like 
Maganding, Masiu, and Taraka together through their shared cultural beauty, suggesting harmony and desirability.

meranaw_proverb:
Boklod a minombaw a man so naga somalong a kini pantaw a Pikong a mithalikop i bantog ka sabapan den ko Nago a ino 
mirangka-lawan ka da ma-ako sawalen o taw ko linding o Ranaw ka tanan iyan bangensa. (Pananaroon o Nago sa Pikong)
literal_translation_meranaw:
Anda i inged odi na antawaa ko manga lolot i da on kapiya-i phoon ko kapephaka poro iyan a 
pekha kowa mapiya. Odi na anda ko manga inged i ba niyan di bangensa
english_translation:
Where and who among the communities and relatives, respectively, have not benefited from its 
development and goodness? Or who among the communities is not related to him?
interpretation:
This line emphasizes the far-reaching influence and kinship of a prominent leader or royal figure. It praises a leader whose positive impact and bloodline 
extend to nearly all communities—suggesting near-universal connection and reverence.
→ Used to legitimize someone's enthronement due to both merit and genealogy.

meranaw_proverb: Barokan ta a lalag ta a ron ta mada' ma-aden na betad a ongangen ta a ron ta masamporna.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Saden sa kiya tamanan ko barokan ka ago so katharo ka na ron ka den kha-akhir, na sa den pen 
sa sindadan o kata-o ago so ongangen ka na ron ka den khapantagi a kapatay
english_translation:
You may end up in your hands and words, and the depth of your knowledge and wisdom has 
reached a point where you will perish.
interpretation:
A cautionary statement about pride and overconfidence. It warns that a person’s own actions (hands) and speech (words)—especially when laced with 
arrogance—can lead to their downfall, even if they are wise or learned.
→ A reminder for leaders to remain humble and restrained.

meranaw_proverb: Da sa oway da sa di, na da sa miphagendokan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Taw a pekha dowa-dowaan a da sa shorong-megendod.
english_translation: People who are unable to make their own decisions are said to be confused.
interpretation:
Leaders—or even common folk—who are indecisive are viewed as lacking clarity or competence. Decision-making is seen as a basic trait of leadership 
and wisdom.

meranaw_proverb:
Rapenet-lintad kano ka pembalingan sa poro so andang a taw sa langit na so maginalong peman a lombos a paranakan na ino di 
kasalongi ka aya bo di khatimbang a tindos a pagimanan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Tareg kano! Ka phakaoma so mapiya a taw a pendato ka ino ari i belos a mapiya a taw a ino di 
den khatingki ka sekaniyan bo i mapipikir o pagtaw.
english_translation:
Calm down and welcome! This good man will lead us because he has always been completely 
good; the reason he cannot be compared is because people remember him constantly.
interpretation:
A warm, celebratory endorsement of a new leader. His track record of goodness makes him beloved and "unmatched," hence worthy of remembrance and 
the role of leadership.
→ A way of rallying support behind an enthroned figure, emphasizing both his moral character and reputation.

meranaw_proverb:
Kagiya pendato ka na taritiba angka so taw na kompasa ngka so inged ka an ka katokawi a piyaka pha-pangkata o kokoman ko 
marandang, na oba ka paki ampit ko kalimbaba-an ka, ka aya ngka phag-ampita ka giyoto i kandato. Na oba ka pamlalag sa 
madakel a kilangan na mada reka so sarig.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aya kandato na tatanora ngka so mga taw na oba ka pephanonogo ko mga kababaan i daradat 
ago betad, seka i pephaki sogo kiran ka giyoto i kandato. Na oba ngka siran sorongi sa akal ka kada’an siran reka sa sarig
english_translation:
Leadership is not allowing the low strata of society to dictate you. Being the one commanding 
them to do something is the best type of good leadership. Never deceive any of them, for they 
may lose their trust and confidence in you.
interpretation:
This reflects a top-down leadership philosophy, where authority and command must be exercised decisively. Yet it also warns against abuse of power or 
dishonesty, as trust from the people is critical to sustained leadership.

meranaw_proverb:
Miya kapiya a Ranaw ka so da mbaloy a towan na mimbaloy a olama na miyakala so pando sa genekan so pa-awing na baden 
miyaka labaw a kiya ndakel o mawag ka so makro ko gowani na imanto na paralo.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Kiya binasaan a Ranaw ka mapiya so da misampay sa towan na somiyayan sa ‘olama’, na 
mindakel so miya aden a mawag na mapiya so haram na biyaloy a halal.
english_translation:
It's hilarious! For those who are not even worthy to be Ulama worshippers but pretend to be 
intellectuals, Ranaw is approaching disaster. As a result, the presence of humiliating deeds is 
necessary in order for activities that were previously forbidden to be recognized as ethically 
right.
interpretation:
A sharp social critique, warning about fake scholars or pseudo-intellectuals who corrupt society. When unworthy people claim authority—especially 
religious or moral—it leads to decline or chaos. The sarcastic tone ("it's hilarious!") emphasizes the absurdity and danger of their influence.

meranaw_proverb: Pephag-odayaw so ig na magegenteng a sathak na phag-orog sa kalodan na ma-anget a sa-igis.
literal_translation_meranaw: Pephag-ambog so taw a da bo a katawan ta a rek-rek iyan inonta ko miyaka itoito.
english_translation: Don't be arrogant or proud because you have the least assets.
interpretation: A direct criticism of someone who acts superior despite having no basis—such as wealth, status, or skill.

meranaw_proverb: Ino a miyaneg ko a milo-lonto so sawaw na da bo a papar iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aya katawi ko rekaniyan ko kapkhanega ko ron na aden a rek iyan odi na mapiya a dii 
mindolona -takinoba a di benar ka da' rekaniyan a ngkoto a ilayan aken rekaniyan.
english_translation:
I assumed he belonged to a higher position or was someone who was nice to deal with, but I was 
mistaken. He's not the person I expected.
interpretation: A disappointment in someone who appeared admirable at first, but later revealed themselves to be unworthy or different.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i sokor mag-antag na so katatangka-i ron, na di ka perang-lebi ka di ka maka lebi.
literal_translation_meranaw:
So panagontaman ago panamar ko nganin ko doniya na sa bo sa kiya sosokodan, na di ka dii phatokal ka di ka bo 
bara-tokal.
english_translation:
The best way is to live a pleasant and moderate life, without being overly proud because you have 
nothing to be proud of.
interpretation: Encourages moderation and humility, pointing out that pride without substance is misplaced.

meranaw_proverb: Phagendod si sinambong na kakaporan iyan bo.
literal_translation_meranaw: Pagoway a kapened ah na kakapetan iyan bo odi na di magso’so’ na kakapetan iyan bo
english_translation: He is limiting his options while attempting to accomplish anything.
interpretation: A critique of someone who restricts themselves—perhaps through poor decisions or narrow thinking—making success unlikely.

meranaw_proverb: Idar-dar a rogong na rarosan o maothang na rarag o maka tana.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Tanto a mala a kapkha nega on a taw sii ko 'ilmo, tamok, menang ago betad na takinoba ka 
kagiya a maka tana na miyaka itoito ago miyaka khap-khap
english_translation:
A person who was thought to be intelligent, wealthy, and honorable ended up being unworthy 
due to his impolite personality and poor performance.
interpretation:
Reveals that external traits or reputation are not enough; true worth lies in character and competence.
→ Don't be deceived by appearances—observe actions and attitude.

meranaw_proverb: Kalokop a domithong a da a maroronan on.
literal_translation_meranaw:
So nganin a pikhonsi-konsian na igira a piyaka tana na da a miya nggona on a mapiya. Giyanan so 
galbek a marata a papagenesen na kagiya misampay sa Yaumul Qiyamah ko oriyan o 
kapatay na da bo kanggona-i o minggalbek on ka da on kabalasi.
english_translation:
A conspiracy is a plan by two or more people to commit wickedness and wrongdoings, and there 
is nothing good or constructive about it.
interpretation:
Defines conspiracy as inherently malicious, with no redeeming quality.
→ A clear moral stance against secretive or underhanded schemes.

meranaw_proverb: So ranon ta ki lolot na idego-dego niyan a karata-rataa ta on.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya i gagaw ta ko lolot na aya katawi niyan on na giyoto den i kambinasaa ta on -ibarat o 
mosawir ta on na pephaka rataan iyan sa ginawa niyan ka pethipon kon o ped iyan.
english_translation:
Some people see brotherly and compassionate advice as a negative act. As a result, even a single 
piece of advice was interpreted as a criticism.
interpretation:
A reflection on defensiveness and pride—how people reject genuine concern and advice by taking it as an attack.
→ Shows the fragile ego or distrust in relationships.

meranaw_proverb: Mawatan den ko alad i ba niyan on ka-ilid.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ini tego den o taw a giya ngkoto a nganin na di den mapenggolaola.
english_translation:
It is the kind of thing you'd never expect to happen, or it's extremely unlikely to happen or 
materialize.
interpretation: Expresses doubt or disbelief—a reaction to an idea or event that's seen as unrealistic or implausible.

meranaw_proverb: Miya baya so penggok ka tig iyan o tholin ko, karam o toli ako i kagaka sa lendeban.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aya katao niyan on na phangaromaan aken pangaromaan aken i aden a manga wata iyan odi na miya ogat
english_translation:
One may be content with the thought of marrying her, but will I marry a pregnant mother 
(with or without a husband)?
interpretation:
A personal reflection on marriage expectations, questioning the social and moral implications of marrying someone pregnant—likely outside of a 
conventional or accepted context.

meranaw_proverb: Phangiring-iring a pong si babendir a di moni.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Oma-oma sa peda a dii mamag-omanti a soma-sayan sa matao a di bo phaka raw tharo, odi na 
soma-sayan sa mala a da bo a katawan ta
english_translation:
Pretending to be knowledgeable while unable to speak, or claiming to be someone when he has 
nothing to prove.
interpretation: A jab at pretenders or frauds—people who claim expertise or status but lack evidence or capability.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den mata-o thandig ko bongknol o ped iyan na di mata-o thandayaw ko bongkog ko likod iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aya bo a pekha ilay niyan na so pa-awing o ped iyan na di niyan khailay so karibatan odi na kamarataan iyan.
english_translation: One only sees the flaws of others and is unable to recognize his own.
interpretation:
Universal critique of hypocrisy and lack of self-awareness.
→ A call for introspection before criticizing others.

meranaw_proverb: Mapa-payag so “Ba” a pekhi rair o dila, na amay bo ka impiten na “Alip” a tomi-tindeg
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba tano den madakel ogaid na amay bo ka thanton ka pagilain na saken bo i khalamba odi na miyaka taros.
english_translation:
Too many of us want to contribute when building something, but I'm the only one who 
finished it in the end.
interpretation:
A reflection on false support or performative teamwork—many people want to be part of success, but few commit to the hard work.
→ Comment on responsibility and empty promises.

meranaw_proverb: Taksil sa pelabi a pengginalawan ko ig a mag-iring sa Dagodob a ginanatan o sarog.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di kano pekha babaya a ba niyo showaa a Dagodob (Lumba a Bayabao) ka sii rekami milelemba so kambilang a taw.
english_translation:
Do not be so proud to pretend to be like Dagodob (Lumba a Bayabao), for we are the 
originators of a truly good personality
interpretation:
This challenges the arrogance or imitation of others, especially those claiming superiority, by asserting the speaker’s group or lineage as the true origin of 
virtue or noble character.

meranaw_proverb: Kilid sa pephatokal a melawan ka melabi a shayan sa Domagandar a phoonan o tabi-at.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di kano aki pephangona-kona a ba niyo pelawani a Domagandar (Poona Bayabao) a ron phoon so mapiya a adat-parangay
english_translation:
Don't try to be too proud ahead of Domagandar (Poona Bayabao), the originator of good manners 
and right conduct.
interpretation:
A warning not to outshine or disrespect a group or person recognized as the founder or symbol of proper behavior.
→ Acknowledging hierarchy and respect for those with cultural or moral authority.

meranaw_proverb:
So peman so Mimbisa na ino da den pangampong ko rimbang iyan sa kadar ka ini pangombaw niyan a kambi-bisai niyan ko 
misharip Alawiya a mini lemba a bansa sa polo aya Mindanao.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Giya peman a Mimbisa (Balo-i) na ino sominibay sa isa ka phangampong maka titingki 
ko lagid iyan sa kala a inged ka siran bo i kiya bembaran ko bangensa o Sharief Alauya a miya bembar a 
bangensa sa Mindanao.
english_translation:
Balo-i made itself a separate state (phangampong) because it was equal with the rest 
of the Phangampong in the sense that it claimed to be the only place whose people descended from 
Sharief Alauya spread all over Mindanao.
interpretation:
An assertion of Balo-i's legitimacy and equality among traditional political divisions (phangampong), backed by shared descent from Sharief Alauya, a 
revered Islamic figure.
→ Genealogical and political justification of autonomy or recognition.

meranaw_proverb: Mapiya anda ka shong na kalongkong ako ngka den.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya aki anda ka den phag-agaw ago bapiya antonaa den i sowaan ka na awid ako den a akal ka.
english_translation: Wherever you go, I will always be your problem or a thorn in your head.
interpretation:
A declaration of persistent opposition, rivalry, or unresolved tension.
→ Could be an expression of defiance or a grudge that follows someone.

meranaw_proverb: Benem-beneng a amo a kagiya siningaan na aya tangkap iyan on na pekha babayaan ta.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mala i beneng a amo a mapasang i kathanos a kagiya siningaan na aya tangkap iyan on na ba pekha babaya-i.
english_translation:
A girl puts on make-up and cosmetics to look like a monkey, expecting that I will fall in love 
with her because she believes I am drawn to her.
interpretation:
A sarcastic and harsh insult targeting someone perceived as trying too hard or inauthentic—mocking superficiality and mistaken assumptions about 
attraction.

meranaw_proverb:
Ba ta den pepenaga ko Amendiya ago so Ya, na raragandang ta pen ko kiya mbalawag o Ba ka amay bo ka impitern na Alip a tomi
-tindeg
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba ta den aki sisiranga sa ngkanan a manga taw a o paka tanaa ngka na si bo si aki oto i mati-tindos kiran.
english_translation: While there are plenty of them, there is just one that is considerably superior to the others.
interpretation: Among many, one stands out in excellence—implying quality over quantity, or the existence of a singularly distinguished person or thing.

meranaw_proverb: Ber-bereg a tontong a anda bo da mipinsor
literal_translation_meranaw: Anda makandaw den a taw a da a phanargan iyan.
english_translation: A wandering person who has no abode.
interpretation: A description of someone with no roots, identity, or place—possibly implying instability, aimlessness, or lack of social standing.

meranaw_proverb: Benar ka maito kon na kanengket a maidan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya maito so kala o kambobolawasan iyan ka maito a mama, na di ngka phanigorowa ka mabager a maongangen.
english_translation: He is small, but terrible.
interpretation: A compact yet powerful person—likely underestimated due to size or appearance but possessing strength or influence.

meranaw_proverb: Da leshaga so gadong na sobong a pirawakan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Pekha babayaan ka so taw na dii ngka bo perawakan sa kagaan a kapatay niyan.
english_translation: You like the person, yet you're hoping for his early demise by praying and working for it.
interpretation: A biting observation about hypocrisy or concealed ill intent—pretending affection while secretly wishing harm.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den mala so dalog a pekha lilid ko lapad a da' a kapadal iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Baden miyaka selasela i lawas na da a bager odi na ongangen iyan.
english_translation: He's basically a large person who lacks physical strength and intelligence.
interpretation: A mocking remark toward someone who appears imposing but is weak and unintelligent—emphasizing that size means nothing without substance.

meranaw_proverb: Penggora-ok so pethad ka iniratan o ragat, na peseghad so bayanek ka pitharotosan o ig.
literal_translation_meranaw: Dii maka perego so pagtaw ka piyalagoyan o olowan a da a sambatan iyan.
english_translation: The people are crying because their leader left them.
interpretation:
Acknowledges the emotional weight and impact of true leadership. The absence of a valued leader causes distress—suggesting genuine admiration or 
dependency.
→ Reflects on the vacuum of power and the importance of wise leaders.

meranaw_proverb: Iponipon sa tiyan na dadapo-an sa likod – Mapiya sa ishangat na bakat sa ithalikod.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden ko mga taw a igira a mindadarpa-i ngka na mapiya reka i adat-parangay ogaid na maka 
talikhod na dii ka niyan phapaka ito on ago pembinasaan ka niyan.
english_translation:
There are certain people who are so nice and friendly when in front of you, but when they meet 
others, they invent stories and defamation against you.
interpretation:
This addresses two-faced behavior, a key source of interpersonal conflict. The line exposes hypocrisy and betrayal, which can escalate tensions.
→ A call to be cautious of deceptive friendships that fuel disputes.

meranaw_proverb: Pangonotan so layag na malo bo kondaraan ka tomagenteng so kalat na an a maka mba-oman a phoon sa lalag iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Panama-namaran so ginawa na di bo tanto itaralo ka pethaman bo so bager na pekha sepok, 
na dii makasendit so taw ago aden ko mga lolot ka maka pendarasag.
english_translation:
While putting in maximum effort to achieve one's life objective, it must be regulated, otherwise 
one's physical and mental capacity and capability will be exhausted, resulting in repentance.
interpretation: Overexertion without balance leads to burnout and regret. It’s a reminder to manage conflict or stress in life wisely, to avoid personal collapse.

meranaw_proverb: Mabaya ta lomoya na menda ta kararasan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mababaya ka sa rido, na di ngka khababayaan so onga niyan a mapait
english_translation: You like trouble, but you hate and/or dislike its effects and consequences.
interpretation:
This criticizes those who provoke conflict but can’t handle its fallout.
→ A warning that if you initiate disputes, be ready to bear the consequences.

meranaw_proverb: Pipharasan so alam sa ka-adilan da thaman na mendod bo so parayasan ko khairan ko Sorga.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya i tamok o taw ago so langowan a kasibisibiyan iyan na ba on den khataman ka so 
doniya na da a ba on kapipiya ginawa -sii khatoon ko Sorga.
english_translation: The world is full of many good things, but all the things in Paradise are far better than those.
interpretation:
This is a spiritual reminder in the face of conflict or temptation, suggesting that peace lies in focusing on eternal values, not worldly desires.
→ Encourages inner peace and detachment to resolve worldly struggles.

meranaw_proverb: Betad o kopor a taw a igira kapa-okan na pendi-lilang sa lalag ka an di kasi-sipati.
literal_translation_meranaw: So makanakanen a mama na igira miya semo den ko ramoding on o babay na mbaram-barang den a ndalinan iyan.
english_translation: An angry person who was full of blame attempted everything he could to get rid of it.
interpretation:
This reflects someone overwhelmed by anger and guilt, trying desperately to escape it.
→ Inner conflict can be resolved only by confronting, not avoiding, blame.

meranaw_proverb: Ino maolad so gi ka ogarinan a menda, na ino landap so tilad ka tepasan a mapa-ok.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino madakel so babay ka o maka mbelag ta na phamamili ako ron sa petpasan aken mangaroma
english_translation: When divorced or separated, there are several options for women.
interpretation:
Acknowledges agency and resilience in women post-conflict. Rather than being ruined, they still have choices.
→ A progressive take on recovery and empowerment after relationship disputes.

meranaw_proverb: Mabaya so pogapok ka phaka bantay sa orog, na kagiya ka-iratan na miyaka ndarokhogan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Miya babaya so babay ka kagiya miyaka ilay sa mala a tamok, na kagiya malngan so tamok na miyaka kipes bo.
english_translation:
The woman is delighted by her wealth, but when it is wasted and drained, she mourns and 
repents.
interpretation:
This shows how attachment to material wealth can lead to sorrow when it disappears.
→ Emphasizes values beyond money as a way to resolve inner conflict.

meranaw_proverb: Kaningkir a khasowa a khabayaan ta so taw na di ta niyan khiyogan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba ta on den miya taman a di ta niyan bo ita-tangkap
english_translation: How sad is the time I spent for her, only to discover that she doesn’t love me.
interpretation:
A personal reflection on emotional disappointment and unrequited love, leading to sorrow.
→ Highlights the pain of misplaced efforts, but also the beginning of emotional closure.

meranaw_proverb: Na sa taw a di ako ron na ino kon o di kami ay mambetad aken.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino o maka mbelag ta ba ako ay phatay
english_translation: Will I die if I file for divorce?
interpretation:
This rhetorical question challenges the fear and stigma surrounding divorce.
→ An empowering statement that hints at liberation over suffering.

meranaw_proverb: Marasay si pengganat na lebi si pengganatan
literal_translation_meranaw: Mara-rata a ginawa o miyaki mbelag na lebi pen so ini mbelag
english_translation:
Divorce is difficult for the person divorcing, and it is even more difficult for the divorced 
woman
interpretation:
Acknowledges the emotional and social toll of divorce, especially on women, who often face harsher judgment.
→ Urges empathy and fair treatment in conflict resolution.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ko tatanora ka an mata-taritib na o peman o nggokta na gomigomin ta baden.
literal_translation_meranaw: Tataritiben aken so galbek ka an mapiya, na kagiya dii ngka nggoketen na gons-gonsengen ta baden
english_translation:
I make sure everything is in the right place, but if you like it to be destroyed, we can put it all in a 
mess.
interpretation:
This is a warning wrapped in sarcasm—someone offers order but is ready to match chaos if provoked.
→ Reveals the fragile balance between peacekeeping and retaliation.

meranaw_proverb: Miyaka toman ako sa da' ko tanto karondan ka o romiyondan ako na miya inalang.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Miyaka toman ako sa da ako sangkop odi na pamangped ko galbek o isa a taw a marata ka o 
somiyangkop ako odi na miyamangped ako ron na imanto na miya alang-alang odi na mini liliya ko
english_translation: To avoid being left behind in the middle of nowhere, I took the right path.
interpretation:
Choosing peace, wisdom, or faith to avoid despair or abandonment in life’s conflicts.
→ A personal decision toward resolution and direction.

meranaw_proverb: Maolay bo so gadong na magendod sa ngganatan, na maronot so rambayong na mbaling sa tharikhodan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Malokes aki so taw na khasoy sa Akhirat, na marombay bo si ginawa na mbaling sa Yaumul Qiyamah.
english_translation: When we get old. Akhirat will be our end.
interpretation:
A final spiritual reflection—this life’s conflicts are temporary, and the afterlife is the real conclusion.
→ Encourages forgiveness and long-term perspective in resolving disputes.

meranaw_proverb:
So olaola o taw na aya ko den parangay na sa adat o ped aken na aya ko den tabi-at -aya mataan-benar na o lebada ka a wator na 
badali ngka sa dodol ka mini pharowaa ka.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa parangay o ped aken na aya ko den parangay ogaid na so karata a adat o mipendolona aken na di aken on imbadal.
english_translation: I treat others the same way he treats me, but I have repaid him nicely.
interpretation: It encourages kindness even in the face of unfairness—a moral lesson in grace, forgiveness, and not repaying evil with evil.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den mata-o mohi na di matao molahi, na ba den mata-o manik si di mata-o panikan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aya bo katawan iyan na giya bo a ginawa niyan-lagid o kapamemegay a mababaya began na di matao mamemegay
english_translation: A self-serving person only understands how to receive and has no desire to contribute.
interpretation: A warning against selfishness and greed, highlighting the imbalance it creates in relationships and society.

meranaw_proverb: Makro so badan ko na paralo so limo ko.
literal_translation_meranaw: Marata ako reka, na mapiya reka so pangalimo aken reka
english_translation: You may think it's horrible, but you appreciate and enjoy what I give you.
interpretation: Critiques hypocrisy—people pretend to dislike something but still benefit from it. A call for honesty and gratitude.

meranaw_proverb: Diden methow so aroy o ba da’a bala iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Langowan a dii manggolaola na pephangangatagen.
english_translation: Every condition, whether favorable or unfavorable, has an inverse, or opposing, effect.
interpretation: A philosophical reminder that life is full of dualities—joy and sorrow, good and bad—so one must learn to be resilient and balanced.

meranaw_proverb: So sagipak a narra na margen katimbangan o sabekes o rasa-as
literal_translation_meranaw:
So taw a babalbegen iyan a ginawa niyan na thomo a di so miyaka dakdakel a mga taw a isa ka mbina- bataa a 
palaya papar.
english_translation: A single powerful man is preferable to a group of weak men.
interpretation: Highlights the value of strength, leadership, and competence over quantity. Not all groups are effective without strong character.

meranaw_proverb: Mapay ka man so tod na di ta kaphanamanan, aya pen o ba kayo a tangked a maglangit.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapay ka man so gantong na an a kipantag iyan aya pen o ba mapiya a taw.
english_translation: Nobody can deny that the other is valuable or useful—how much more so for a royal?
interpretation: Everyone has value, and if ordinary people are valuable, those in high positions should be even more responsible and worthy.

meranaw_proverb: So sanggibo a ranon na piyatay o tadman.
literal_translation_meranaw:
So satiman a miya nggolaola a marata o ped a taw sii reka na kiya daan den sa kipantag so tanto a 
madakel a mini ogop iyan reka a mapiya.
english_translation: A single mistake or misbehavior can erase thousands of good deeds.
interpretation: A strong moral warning about consistency and reputation—it takes years to build trust and one wrong act to destroy it.

meranaw_proverb: Di ngka den iinama so binagol a ped ka, da bo a gola ka a mipshiyantan ka.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Di ngka den kasi-sigin so mapiya a kata-ta'ama o isa a taw ko betad iyan a mapiya ka matag on 
penggaget a rareb ka ka da bo a rek ka on
english_translation: Don't be envious of someone else's comfortable life because you cannot have what he already has.
interpretation: Teaches contentment and realism. Envy only brings suffering; it’s better to focus on your own path.

meranaw_proverb: Di ka lengan ginawa na sama ka on ginawa.
literal_translation_meranaw: Igira a piyaka mbaya-baya ka o ped ka na lamba-i ngka on so ped ka, di ngka pelenga-lengana.
english_translation:
When someone offers you anything, don't be rude; take what you need and leave the rest to 
someone else.
interpretation: Promotes humility, politeness, and fairness—don’t be greedy or disrespectful when receiving gifts or blessings.

meranaw_proverb: Di alongan o bangensa so alongan o pengga-os odi na… Di mosim o bangensa so mosim o tatamoken.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Da bali o bangensa ka sa bo sa maka babalbegen o da a tamok ka a kaphanarigan ka 
na mapiya i bangensa ngka na di ngka bo khasanaan.
english_translation:
Power and means are more important than blood — you can't rely on kinship if you don't 
have them
interpretation: A hard truth about self-sufficiency—family ties alone won’t save you if you lack the resources or skills to support yourself.

meranaw_proverb: Ola-ola lalag ta a ron ta mada’ ma-aden betad a ongangen ta a ron ta matay-mawiyag.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa den sa okitokit o taw marata antaa ka mapiya na ron ka den khapantagi a kapatay.
english_translation:
Life is a game, but it’s you who must say, whether a cheat or sportsmanship, it’s you who 
must play and meet your end.
interpretation: Life is full of choices, and you are responsible for the ethics of your actions—whether you live honestly or deceitfully, you must face the consequences.

meranaw_proverb:
An a linang bolawan a dii kapag-inaman sa iman a samporna a maka dorat i lalag, na an matag sapo a maregen a limbanan ka di 
ta niyan ndoraten.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden a mapiya a taw a o di ngka ka-iktiyari na phaka binasa reka na aden peman a di tanto 
mapiya a taw a margen o ba ta kalipati ka di ta niyan phag-akalan.
english_translation:
One may be noble, descending from a royal family, but ignoble in character—the other may be 
ordinary, but truthful and honest.
interpretation: Challenges class bias—true nobility comes from character, not bloodline. A call to value honesty and humility.

meranaw_proverb: Porong ka porom-potal ka o di ka porom-potal na porom-potalen ka taw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Phiyapiya ka sa parangay ka o di ka phiyapiya na mebonoon ka a taw.
english_translation: Do your best because if you don't, someone will put you in a sack or murder you.
interpretation: An exaggerated but powerful warning—laziness or mediocrity can be dangerous, especially in competitive or harsh environments.

meranaw_proverb: So di ta iga-gaid na ron kalamay so gadong, na so ita-tangked ta na ron so Allahu a’lam (maana pagaranganan).
literal_translation_meranaw: So taw a di itatapi-an na takinoba a aya mapiya, na so aya katawi ta on na mapiya na aya bes marata.
