english_translation: What we don't expect to be good is good, but what we think is good is bad.
interpretation: Urges caution and open-mindedness—appearances deceive, and judgment should be based on truth, not assumptions.

meranaw_proverb: Matanog i dalpek na korang i palalagoy
literal_translation_meranaw: Berak a talpak den a ngari iyan, ogaid na da bo a mapenggalbek odi na khapasad iyan
english_translation: Good in speaking, but not so much at doing or producing
interpretation: Words are easy, but actions are hard. True character is shown through deeds, not speeches. A lesson in walking the talk.

meranaw_proverb: Nggoro-goro ka goro ka o ari o minggoro so andang a goro ami na aya pen di penggoro so goro o morit ami.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di ngka shana-i so katao ngka ka o ari pephaganad den so goro na seka pen i di toma-taros mangnal a matag morit
english_translation:
Search for knowledge from the cradle to the grave. Don’t give up learning. You may have 
learned something, but there are still many more things you ought to learn and discover.
interpretation: Lifelong learning is a moral duty. No matter how much you know, there’s always more to discover. Stay humble and curious.

meranaw_proverb:
So paraman o ganding na laksa man ka ona na insarati ngka mona ka tabiya ko kha-ori ka toba ako maori na asar a towis ako ko
phamaginapasaan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
So matao ko katharo na mawatan den a kao-ona niyan, ogaid na di niyan pipikira o ba mao-ona 
den ka aden a mao-ori a maka lelebi a di sekaniyan
english_translation:
The knowledgeable have always been first in line, but never pretend to be first, for there may be 
someone ahead of you who is more knowledgeable.
interpretation: Knowledge earns respect, but pretending to be wise is dangerous. Be humble—someone always knows more than you.

meranaw_proverb:
Maka pira somagad i maka rampana sa dar na ba ngka den pethongkopa sa di ron kaseban a taw ka aya man ari a darem na ba an a 
mata-o ron inonta so Allah.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya i dii kakha rata a ginawa ngka na rarareba ngka baden -di ngka den pephamanothola.
english_translation: The more shattered your heart is, the more patience you will need to accept your feelings.
interpretation: Emotional pain requires deep patience and self-compassion. Healing is not quick—acceptance is part of growth.

meranaw_proverb: Minsan oray bolawan i oran sa di ta inged na mapag-iroy ta bo so tarintik sa ngganatan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya pen bolawan den a pekha sokat ko kena o ba ta inged na aden bo a masa a ikhadali ta so tithow a inged ta.
english_translation: There's no place like home, no matter how wealthy your life may be in a faraway location.
interpretation: No matter how far or successful you go, home holds a special, irreplaceable value. It’s a source of identity and comfort.

meranaw_proverb: O da bo so kibolog na mosala mendod ako, na o da so kitaloga na tobaw mbalingan ako.
literal_translation_meranaw: O da ko mimbologan so katharo odi na nggolaola na di aken den nggolaolaan –mataan a so kasendit na sii sa oriyan
english_translation:
Repentance is always the last stage in the process – I would not have proposed it if I had 
known its result.
interpretation: Sometimes we regret actions only after consequences unfold. It's a lesson in foresight and wise decision-making.

meranaw_proverb:
Parabowat o tapar so gandawali o lalag, na galigala gomampang so malayat a ongangen a gonday o kandiyandi, na sa di panday ko 
langka na mitarobang ko korang na sa peman sa malim on na aya matindos-rabaw.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Paramanis o kalilimod so kapkha pangka o pitharo, na pekhi-ren ko nama ago so maratabat so 
ongangen, ogaid na sa di maka sowa nggedageda na khi-shosong, na sa peman sa masowa iyan so 
kapamlalag na aya kha-paratiyayaan.
english_translation:
The beauty of talking is during an argument, and wisdom is the remedy for emotional pride, 
those who may not reflect and control their temper have done wrong, but those who may successfully 
manage their temper will prosper.
interpretation: Wisdom in speech and control in anger are rare and powerful virtues. Those who master this find peace and success.

meranaw_proverb:
Sa alongan imanto na mimbinentay ko masa so daradat o timbangan ka mapened so ilmo a di so salakaw ron, na o ndaya so 
kata-o na phangarongka so sigay a pethimbawaw ko palaw na melangkap ko doniya, na o di manggolaola na ba den karam a intan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Imanto aki na kiya tokawan a aya bo a mala i kipantag na so 'ilmo a di so mapiya antonaa na 
miyaka ngen imanto si aki aya (so miyaka sowa), na o maka ndaya so manga taw a ndodon so 'ilmo 
na ipthagompiya o betad-mataan den anan a benar.
english_translation: Learning and applying knowledge in real-life can lead to greater development and success.
interpretation: Knowledge alone is not enough—application is key to real progress and self-improvement.

meranaw_proverb: Di mariray so Butig ka aya mona tepadan o lalaog a da mada na di maya' so Unayan ka mona kalontanaan o tolos a da marendan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Bantogan a Butig odi na giya Unayan a siran i paka poon o bangensa.
english_translation: Butig or Unayan takes pride in being the source of the Meranaw nation.
interpretation: This reflects cultural pride and a call to honor one's roots. It's a moral reminder of ancestry and heritage.

meranaw_proverb:
Inako mona sebang na alongan romiyanti na mimbinentay so sigay ko dalinding o sebangan na miya magayaw-ayaw sa 
katabilangan sa ig na miya rending a kilat na miyag-oraday lena a 
saleg iyan ko langit nago man a miya palang, na o tindeg so paayaw na mendod sa mariwada so pephagaolan a ig na somebang 
so alongan a pamoreg o doniya.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Sii ko paganay na aya katao ta ko taw na khabaloy a ikapiya o inged, nago ma-aden so 
marata ko sabala sa inged na lomiya-olad ko inged so kasa-sansara, na o pagtiga na khada' so margen 
a kapapantagan a magegedam na meliwanag so inged.
english_translation:
At first glance, the populace believed he would bring kindness and triumph, but he brought ruin 
instead. If someone came up and led, he would perish from the scene, and everything would 
return to normal.
interpretation: Leaders can deceive through appearances. Real leadership shows in results, not promises. Be wary of false messiahs.

meranaw_proverb:
Ikararanon aken so dimalapang sa langit ka mirogong ka magondas na da ontawar ko laod ka miya pampang ko palaw a 
sisigayan o senang a alongan a maranti na dii kaphandapatan ka so maomag sa sebangan na aya katotongkopan ko iplimbo a 
ranon a i-aayoong keneg ko paka minanad o ig a ipephagayaw-ayaw o lalanen a madakel.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Kanogon iyan ka miyaka talingoma so aya katao ta on na ba sii phoon ko langit, na mala a 
totholan on na lagid o ini sedep a sisip a miya da’ so totholan, na dii mapamimikiran ka sii bo miya 
ribon ko andang a taw ko inged a iba-bangkit ko madakel a taw.
english_translation:
It is unfortunate that a shopworn angel has gained public admiration, but he vanished from view only 
to realize that he had merged with the former. It is inconvenient.
interpretation: Fame based on illusion fades fast. When someone tries to imitate another’s greatness, they often lose their own identity.

meranaw_proverb:
Ino a miya neg ko a kikilaten so palaw na raragandangen a ig na mimbinentay so sirig ko dalinding o sebangan na maka phamagikata a 
kini songgod o linog na aya bo kekenegen a gandamato damdag, na so sapangkat ko palaw na da on dagoong so ig a 
giyoto so mapantaw a aya katotongkopan ko bitoon a mishangkad, na so kini pantaw niyan ko bakolod ko sendigan na somibang si 
karani, na o maka pagayaga a dowa oto a saleg na odi tindeg so gaos a panggaga daromimbang na baden matag alongan a da on 
so rangka niyan a pangorandig o alam.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Lagid o pekha gedam aken a aden a dii kambabantaanan ko tomampar sa sebangan a 
marata a ikha-binasa o betad na ino aya bo a pephaka gedam on na sekitano bo na san ko ped a 
inged na kena o ba lagid aya -baanda sabap sa so aden a taw kiran a mapephamitoon a mapiya i 
kandato na o maka talingoma na meliwanag sharoman so inged, na odi maka pamagogopa so 
manga papasang na giyaya den i betad a phagilain ta a pephaka liwanag so masa ogaid na da a tanto a kareg iyan.
english_translation:
We've heard that tragedy is coming from the east, so why not from the west? Perhaps there is a 
good leader in that place who is well-liked by the populace, and if we happen to have one, our place 
will shine once more.If we don't form a group of people who work 
together, we'll keep seeing our lives as bright and pleasant, but we won't make any progress.
interpretation: Leadership renewal requires unity and collective effort. Without cooperation, even with potential, progress stalls.

meranaw_proverb:
Liwanag ka Bembaran a miyathay pimbaratan ka sa alongan imanto na tanan kiya borodan a pasandalan a baning so 
mimbala-bala kampong na di ta kapenggalawan ka tiyaladay a sonor na di ta khi-rido sa dar ka so ira-ragandang ko ig na 
phagimalaw kargan, na kapthomangkedan ta ka manginon o malinding ko bagambangan o kadeg na di kawan o mandadas ka 
mapiya maka labo ko bagambangan o reges na di ta ipangangandam ka mala a sarig ta on ka ndodon so paninindeg.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Paka pipiya o inged ago so pagtaw ron a ginawa iran ko oriyan o miyathay den ay na masa-sansara ka imanto na 
miyamaka talingoma so manga taw ko piyaginged-ingdan a manga ala i 
sambatan ogaid na di ta bo peman katawan ka so mapiya kiran na di ta kapthantowan mogop
inangin na sekaniyan na mapiya mokit sa kamargenan na di niyan ishangkop so kamapiyaan ka manenema on so tindeg
english_translation:
I wish you all the best for my city and its people! Following a lengthier period of disorder 
and insecurity, some of our citizens from various sections of the country are striving for political 
leadership. Although some of them are nice people who will not gamble with other people's well-being,
they lack the financial wherewithal to do so.
interpretation: Political leadership should be based not only on character but also resources. Good intentions aren't enough without capability.

meranaw_proverb:
So alongan pelangkap a pethimbawaw ko palaw na mala a kawan ta on ka oba baden di langkap so saleg o sindaw niyan ka aya 
pekhaneg aken na di phagayon-ayonan a kashong a taw ko langit na di kaphandapatan ka oba lalan so dapat na nogon o 
pekharendam a da sampay sa kadiyat ka ba den miya sansara.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden a taw a dii kamba-bantaanan a penggemaw na malo ta bo ika-awan ka oba baden di peman maka nggagayan so 
kapiya niyan sabap sa dii phapawalaan o andamanaya i okit a kata-ayon, na dii ta dii mapamimikiran ka oba di maka 
taros na miya binasa peman so okit ka miya taman so pagtaw ko kapha-pawala sa tindeg
english_translation:
Someone appears in the open, willing to serve the people, but no one can guarantee that they will 
join the race because the people do not yet have unanimity of support.
interpretation: Even sincere candidates need unified support. A fragmented society fails to uplift new leaders, delaying change.

meranaw_proverb:
Nako kanda-darola o bago a songgod a ig na tatarimaan iyan sa rek iyan so bantogan nago matkaw a lalis a salongan sa impitan 
na ndigayan mimbalingan ko asal a panagayana a riyawat a iniring a poon a peshayanan a kapephananadman so asal a tanda 
iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Gowani ko paganay den a ndato so bago a mindato na aden a isa kiran a dii niyan tharoon a 
sekaniyan bo i mapiya kiran -nago mitalemba so masa a margen a tiyoba, na miya panongganoy 
peman o pagtaw so miyanga oona a manga pipiya i kandato a manga taw.
english_translation:
When the new leaders first held power, one of them was assumed to be honorable, but when 
disaster struck, the people thought of the courage and wisdom of the previous leaders in protecting 
the people and the community
interpretation:
In times of crisis, people reflect on the wisdom and courage of past leaders. It teaches us to choose leaders carefully, based not on image but on proven 
integrity.

meranaw_proverb:
O migadong sa Ranaw so taritib ago sempad na pethalo-talo maog so randangan o rawaka, na o mada' sa iranon so pimistar a adat a 
biyanay a ijma a panginma o bansa a pamoreg o kadato, na so alongan pelangkap a pethimbawaw ko palaw na khada' so rangka 
niyan, na o di manggolaola na ba den ganti a lenga.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Ngkaya den i ka da' o andang a kandi-diyator a Ranaw na pekha tagonanay den a kakha da’ o 
darpa o bantoga a iringan-songgiringan a miyangeren sa barat, na o mada’ sa Iranun so ini 
towang ko adat a sasartaan o ijma a ikapiya o bangensa a kataid o kadato, na sedepan o alongan 
na khada’ so kali-liwanag iyan, na mataan a mapenggolaola den anan.
english_translation:
When the people of Ranaw arrive, disorganized, the place where once the celebrated 
people come to perish, and if the sun will not shine again for the people, it is because their ancestor's 
leadership has been distorted.
interpretation:
A once-glorious people fall into ruin when they abandon the strong leadership and values of their ancestors. Disunity and the loss of guiding traditions lead 
to decline.

meranaw_proverb:
Gowani ko baden tig na aya katao ta on na ba phaka talingoma so katolosan ko langit -na so kiya ndaging iyan na baden kiya 
tokawan a kasaromanti iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Gowani ko da pen mabinentay tharo na aya katao ta on na aya miyaka talingoma na Malaikat 
ko langit –na so kiya tharo iyan na takinoba a di matao a pephamanayan-sayan
english_translation: We assume he is knowledgeable before he speaks, but after he begins, we see he is only pretending.
interpretation: Don't judge a person by appearances or position. True wisdom is revealed through action and speech, not assumptions.

meranaw_proverb:
An a mombaw a masa a ma-ada' sa ginawa ka kagiya siyalgan o borawan datomanong so mata-tangked a khirek na o di kapag-
imani na kha-arogan sa khada' na awid a pamikiran ka maka penggigibasa so isa bo sa pompongan ka benar man ka seray so 
ig na isa a paka poon ko kaphag-ontawar iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden ko miyanga oona a masa a kiya limbanan a taw ka kagiya miya kowa mapiya na 
miyangimporo-an odi na miyangalandada -na o di niyan ma-inengka a ginawa niyan na awid a akal 
iyan ka miyaka tho-tolaka so mbata-bataa ko kapaka popoon ko kaphagari-ari o manga lokes a miya bembar a isa 
sa paka poon.
english_translation:
There was once a man who was forgotten by time because when he became successful, he 
became arrogant—he should check that because the kinship tie was broken because of him
interpretation: Arrogance born from success leads to broken relationships and isolation. Humility is essential, especially when rising in status.

meranaw_proverb:
Kanogon o ka-aog o asal a ini gambar a pagawang tano mona ka aya lebi ko andang so di ron kaplimbani ka mamalampak i 
bekaw, na amay ka ba kha-tangked a saliyo so talibon a magaan bo komlas na khapanon so alaga a phag-arapen dingilan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Margen o ba paka lipati so bangensa ka miyaka ribrang den, na amay ka ba shambi-a sa tamok a so 
tamok na pekha da’ na miya paneng so kaplolot.
english_translation:
It is disastrous to forget kinship because it has extended. If wealth becomes the object of love, the 
closeness of ties loosens.
interpretation: Prioritizing wealth over relationships corrodes family and community bonds. Love should not be rooted in materialism

meranaw_proverb:
Ba den ka sa imanto a mikha-dakel sa Ranaw so bokalag a montiya na di ta on ririkoran a rorombikiten ta on, paratiyaya so 
taw sa o di maka mbalawag so datomanong ko inged na pantar so pat a alam.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Baden aki kagiya imanto na mindakel so manga bai odi na miyamaka sowa di ta mi-aawid a
akal so kapamangaroma ogaid na awid pamikiran, paratiyayaan tano a o da mabaloy a mapiya a taw 
sa Ranaw a phanapar a phameges na kiya binasaan so betad.
english_translation:
Today, there are so many women who are easy to choose but problematic. Calamities will befall 
us if we cannot find somebody to control and enforce discipline. Or if there are already a lot of 
successful and wealthy people who aren't following the rules, and there is no one to keep 
them in line, then wait for disaster.
interpretation: A warning about lack of discipline and moral standards. When leaders or members of society do not uphold values, disaster is inevitable.

meranaw_proverb:
Da pen samber so ndo’ na pephamagayaw-ayaw so karodan sa Iranon, na da pen dansal so bagel na siyalangkap so tambo a 
laod so maliboteng, na o rantawa ta milay so sasilang ko layagen na lagid o papalangen sa salindaw a komirap ka nanao 
ko Iranon ka kagiya khi-lemba on so tihaya maka ombaw a khapayag on so da-ag
literal_translation_meranaw:
Da pen maka talingoma so phaka talingoma tawna mbaram-barang den a petharoon o madakel 
a taw, na da pen mamaka beken so phamaka bekenen na mini dapolog den so karatas a ipephag
-apply inangin na mawatan pen, na o ilay ta so sabala na pimbarang pishoson den a manga taw ka 
nanao den anan sa kagiya khakowa so singanin.
english_translation:
Long before something expected is realized, many forms of commentary are heard, offices 
have yet to be established, application papers are numerous, and on the other side, various people, 
male and female, young and old, are waiting
interpretation: People rush to claim positions or anticipate outcomes before real work has begun. A reminder to be patient and let substance precede ambition.

meranaw_proverb:
Di ka shayan sa gabon a dii mangimporo-an ka margen ka misampay ko randong a pikir ka, aya man a mataan na da' a 
gabon sa poro a ba di paniyambra na aya man a kargen a kabosoga ko kawang na da' man a palakat on na maroshang ka 
sa baba na mbaloy ka kongkoya a pekha doan- doanan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Di ka tanto phag-ambog ka tiyobaan ka. Da a maporo a ba di mama-mayas sa ndo, na ba aden a 
gabon a ba di peshambra a ndo'. So langit na maporo a da' a ba on towak na o tanto ka 
pangimporo-an na pethaman bo so bager na kha-olog ka sa baba na di ka den khamaya-mayaan.
english_translation:
Try not to be too arrogantly dismissive, for you might succeed. Clouds are quickly taken away by 
the wind, and the sky is too high without a stairway. Physical power may tire you, and you 
will plummet down dead or injured
interpretation: Arrogance is fragile. Overconfidence leads to downfall. Strength must be paired with humility and awareness of one’s limitations.

meranaw_proverb:
Pangalimbabaan ka ka an ka maka saginda ko bitoon ko lethingan a sii pephamangrap ko mati-tingkong a danaw ko tampar sa 
kababaan na khalangag ka o taw a sii ka bes ko langit.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Pangangalimbabaan ka na aya sayani ngka na bitoon san ko langit a benar den a sishii ko kaporo-an na so ipephamangrap 
iyan a manga pipiya a mbaram-barang i saleg na sii pekha-along ko 
matatangel a danaw san ko mababa a kalopaan ogaid na o langag so taw sa poro na khatokawan 
iran a sii ka bes sa kaporo-an a totolongan ka siran a ipembegay ngka kiran so sindaw a pishoson i warna a ikapiya ginawa.
english_translation:
Be moderate in everything you do and keep a low profile, like the stars high above whose light 
reflects its colors down a small pit of water, but when people look up, they will unnoticeably find 
you high above, bringing them pleasures and happiness.
interpretation: Modesty and quiet excellence are more powerful than loud success. Like distant stars, true value is noticed by those who look carefully.

meranaw_proverb:
So taritib sa Ranaw na di pagalok-alokan ka khi-galed a binamban a patilakan si tegeb na so sempad sa Iranon na di 
mapendi-dimatag ka kembo paniyambra so pagawang ago sempad na piyanamber a dapat so mala-ilang sa karang ka 
tomiyalaban so taw ko kapshalangkap o ig ka miphayag si di topor na piyanga babagowan sa di royod o legawan so betad o 
kaphag-inged.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Di tano ndidi-matagen so atoran o manga lokes sa Ranaw a mona a mamaginged ka khabalambanan so 
ndolon-dolonan o pagtaw -so deso kiya paka lipati ron na miyaka thotolaka so 
pagtaw ka aya den a biyalingan a mokarna na kasha-sakoya ko kadato ago so tamok ago so 
pirakna miya aden so di kaptetembo-ay na kibagowan so manga adat-parangay sa di ped o 
olaola a adat a ganat o manga lokes, na khi-galed so kapephag-inged na phaka onot on so taw a palaya den khagtan.
english_translation:
Putting aside our ancestors' traditions and customary laws will hinder our mutuality by 
severing kinship ties; racing for money, wealth, and political power will become the object of 
love, resulting in arrogance; manners and conduct will be infused with foreign elements that are not 
part of our ancestors' legacy, resulting in doom.
interpretation: Rejecting cultural values in pursuit of power or wealth breeds arrogance and loss of identity. Cultural erosion leads to social decay.

meranaw_proverb:
Mabasar a dayagen a Balabagan minombaw a dibaloy a Rawaten a sakeb a Komaradang a pimbeknan o Amben a isa ko 
lima noni a bangensa miya moreg- (Pananaroon o Amben sa Balabagan)
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya a kapkha ilaya sa Balabagan a tingki a Maguindanao ago giya Komaradang a ron taw so 
Amben a isa ko 5 noni a miya bembar sa Ranaw.
english_translation:
Consider Balabagan, which is equally beautiful as Maguindanao and Komaradang and is the home 
of Amben, one of the five Noni and a source of ancestry
interpretation: An appreciation of one's heritage and ancestral land. A call to recognize the beauty and importance of lesser-known yet culturally significant places.

meranaw_proverb: Anda shong so dalsan o di bo mendod ko poon.
literal_translation_meranaw: Anda shong so doniya ago so langowa dalem iyan o di sii ko Miyaden on a so Allah SWT.
english_translation: The earth will return to its Creator –Allah SWT.
interpretation: Everything is temporary. A reminder of divine accountability and that all things ultimately return to God.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i inambar o taw na aya den kalabo-an.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Sa den sa pinggalbek o taw na aya niyan den khailay sii sa Yaumul Qiyamah o mapiya na so Sorga, na o 
marata na so Naraka Jahannam.
english_translation:
What you do in this life determines what you get in the afterlife — good is Paradise, terrible is 
Hellfire.
interpretation: Actions in this world have eternal consequences. Moral living leads to Paradise; immoral actions lead to Hellfire.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i piyamaroraw na aya kabarantanan
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa den sa miya nggalbek –marata antaa ka mapiya na khailay o manosiya so pantag o balas iyan.
english_translation: You will be rewarded for what you have done (good or bad).
interpretation: A universal law of karma or divine justice. Every deed has a consequence, here or in the afterlife.

meranaw_proverb: Anda showa so parang o di sii ko salakop-di mbawata so pakal sa manggayi.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa den sa parangay o mbala a lokes na aya den mambo mapepharangay o moria taw.
english_translation: Parents' manners and conduct are what their children will adopt.
interpretation: Parents model behavior for their children. Values and actions are passed down through generations.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i pantag o pantaw na sa kamamasa-i ron.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aya den a bontal o galbek na sa den sa kapkha ilaya on
english_translation: An outcome is the result of what the work is and how it is done
interpretation: Success is not just about effort, but also doing the right thing in the right way. Quality of work determines results.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i odaren ko dang ago so gopen piragon.
literal_translation_meranaw: Anda i mala a khakowa on a gona so mona sa walay anta-a ka so mori.
english_translation: Which is better and more useful, the first or second wife?
interpretation:
A reflection on value and loyalty; perhaps a metaphor asking: what truly matters—what came first or what serves better? It could challenge superficial 
comparisons in relationships or decisions.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i pantag i kindang na karo-rongawan iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: So kipantag o galbek odi na taw na sa den sa betad iyan.
english_translation: Whatever or whoever is the work or a person, the result is how it is done or who he is, respectively
interpretation: The outcome of any task or person is determined not by the label or title but by the quality of effort or character.

meranaw_proverb: Adil-adil so kapal na bagemberan so biday
literal_translation_meranaw: Ndi-ditar so taw na kasa-sawaan so aurat iyan
english_translation: Naked despite being clothed due to their transgressions (Hadith).
interpretation: A moral warning: outward appearances can hide inner sins. Despite material cover, guilt and wrongdoing are visible to the divine.

meranaw_proverb: An a manik o an a manog.
literal_translation_meranaw: So kapangalimo na peshambi-an o Allah SWT.
english_translation: Giving shall be replaced by the Creator.
interpretation: An encouragement to be generous—what you give will be repaid or blessed by God.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i lebi ko andang a dalig a mangondaya ago so gopen khi-bago a sii bo ko kompasan na da sa kakhondaliya-i.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Anda i mapiya ko andang a darodopa a mala i bangensa ago so gopen phangaromaa a sii bo sa 
kaphantas na di ta mipshaliya ko konenta sa dadayan
english_translation:
Whatever or whoever the task or person is, the outcome is determined by how it is completed or 
who he is.
interpretation: A repeated sentiment (see #2): the result relies more on integrity and execution than labels or intentions.

meranaw_proverb: Adiyadi ba ako a di sa rendagan ako.
literal_translation_meranaw: Di ako den aki o ba on phaka awid a akal aken odi na misendit aken baden.
english_translation: Never mind if only to have a problem or repent at last.
interpretation: It's better to face a challenge and come to repentance than to avoid growth or accountability.

meranaw_proverb: Adiyadi ba aden a di sa madayon a da' a manenenteng a da den.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya pen maito na asar a mata-tangked a aden.
english_translation: It doesn't matter how small it is, as long as I have it.
interpretation: A lesson in contentment and gratitude—even small blessings are worth cherishing.

meranaw_proverb: An a maya di lengin a tomalingoma rasay, na an a di lilingain a tomparak a tiyoba.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aden a nganin a phaka binasa a di tanto iinengkaan, na aden peman a di tatago on sa ginawa a o maka talingoma na siksa.
english_translation:
There may be something dangerous that goes unseen, and there may be something detrimental 
that goes unreported but has terrible consequences.
interpretation: A caution: unseen or unspoken problems can still cause great harm. Stay vigilant.

meranaw_proverb: An a mata-o thanding ko katanog o tintikan, na di mata-o thandayaw ko kareg o pandaopan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aden a taw aya bo a katawan iyan nggalbek naso maito, na di matao nggalbek sa mala.
english_translation: There are those who can accomplish simple tasks but not larger or more complex ones.
interpretation: A lesson in humility and self-awareness—know your limits and capabilities.

meranaw_proverb: An a tothol a benar a di lenganan sa indan, na an a tig a di benar a di peman paka da-an.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aden a tothol a benar den ogaid na di peman tanto paka angden, na aden a tothol a di benar a malo bo iiktiyaran.
english_translation:
There is information that is accurate and real, but it should not be feared, and there is information 
that is truly untrue, yet caution should be exercised.
interpretation: Critical thinking is key: not all truths are harmful, and not all lies are harmless.

meranaw_proverb: An a maya mapanton a o paka mbayaa ngka na rek iyan so rek iyan na rek iyan pen so reka.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden a taw a di kha-onsran odi na di khapeno a o began ka on so bayabaya na khowaan iyan sorekiyan ko nganin, 
na iprakes iyan pen so rek o isa a taw.
english_translation:
There are those who, when given all the options, should take their own and all those that 
are due to others.
interpretation: A critique of greed and selfishness—some take more than their fair share.

meranaw_proverb: Mapiya ka maribon ka na ay di ko katawan ko sarog a langka ka.
literal_translation_meranaw: Matay ka pen aki na palaya ko den katawan so okitokit ka.
english_translation: You may be dead, but I know all about you (conduct).
interpretation: Your reputation and character live on after death.

meranaw_proverb: An a narra mishisik a ino bes miyag-nor ka gas a mimbarimbingan a mala-lapot a koray.
literal_translation_meranaw: Anda i lebi ko andang a dalig a mangondaya ago so gopen khibago a sii bo ko kompasan na da sa kakhondaliya-i.
english_translation:
There are those who gained the love and sympathy of the people for their good conduct 
and manner until they grew older.
interpretation: Consistent good character earns lasting respect and affection.

meranaw_proverb: Ba sala' ko kanggaring i kapkha tokawi ta ko olaola o ped ta.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ba ari marata a kapkha tokawi ta ko parangay o ped ta
english_translation: There is no wrong with knowing one’s own behaviour and conduct.
interpretation: Self-awareness is a virtue—it’s not wrong to reflect on oneself.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den basa marandang na di onot o kadarem ka tondoga ngka a ilat ka malo' ka roo den a maphamanondog ka.
literal_translation_meranaw: Baden aki mapiya a taw na marata i adat-parangay ka di phaka neg sa matag ilat-ilat ka dii mbakorot.
english_translation: He has a good physical personality or appearance, but is not true to his manners and conduct.
interpretation: External appearance doesn't guarantee good character—true worth lies in how one behaves.

meranaw_proverb: Benar kon ka seray so ig na isa bo sa pompongan, na benar a mbaa-baad na isa sa ontawaran.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya pen mbida-bida tano sa bangensa na isaisa a phoonan tano
english_translation: While we differ in clan, we have one ancestral origin.
interpretation:
Despite differences, we are fundamentally connected.
→ A call for unity, humility, and mutual respect.

meranaw_proverb: Madaya bo so tapar o bilang a taw so khirek, na linang soti so khirek o matao so khirek on.
literal_translation_meranaw: Da a boring o babay o matao ron so mama, na limpiyo so mama o matanosen so babay ka matao melimpiyo.
english_translation: If the husband knew how to become good, the wife would be good and beautiful
interpretation:
A man's behavior influences the harmony of the marriage.
→ Moral teaching on mutual responsibility and emotional intelligence in relationships.

meranaw_proverb: Barokan ta a lalag a ron ta mada' maaden na betad a ongangen ta ron ta masamporna.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa bo sa pinggalbek ka na aya ngka on kipantag, na sa olaola ngka na ron ka on den kharoshang
english_translation: What you have done is what you will have, and your character is what you will be destined for.
interpretation:
Karma-like message: your actions shape your future.
→ Self-teaching on accountability and integrity.

meranaw_proverb: Bagemberan sa baba na awas-awas sa poro.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sasawaan iyan so bok iyan, na ndiditar pen sa ma-ines.
english_translation: No head scarf, and dressed tight.
interpretation:
A comment on modesty, likely urging moral or cultural standards in appearance.
→ A lesson in maintaining dignity and respectability.

meranaw_proverb: Ba gowani ko mona a pamomolo so daog a kababagombar iyan, kagiya sa imanto na mapiya da' pharini na silalaw phiklasan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Ba ari gowani ko kangodaan a pamomolowan so kangoda, imanto na mapiya pen da khorang so 
babaya o ginawa na aya mataan na mikhorang so bager o lawas.
english_translation: Unlike when one is young, when one gets mature, love doesn’t wane, but strengths fade away.
interpretation:
With age, love remains but physical capacity diminishes.
→ A reflection on aging, patience, and enduring affection.

meranaw_proverb: Baden basa kargan so polala sa dansalan ka iratan bo so pethad na liwaleg a misambi.
literal_translation_meranaw: Baden aki alo-alo a mala a kapkhanega on, na ngkaya den i kapalagoy ron a taw, na awid a akal a kha-tampar
english_translation: While he may be popular for a short time, when his supporters turn away, he will face issues.
interpretation:
Fame is temporary; one must rely on character, not just attention.
→ A moral on humility and sustainability of virtue.

meranaw_proverb: So peragandang ko ig na aya kambalinganan.
literal_translation_meranaw: So aki so kaplolot na mapiya andamanaya den na ron ta on bo pagendod (ka di khasanaan so tamok)
english_translation: To kin and relatives, where you will turn for help.
interpretation:
Family is your fallback in hard times.
→ Teaching on maintaining strong familial ties.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den man ari sagad so kintay na kakal so pimbasokan.
literal_translation_meranaw: So kawiyagoyag na baden sagad ko doniya na aya khatatap na so miya pasad a 'amal ko doniya sii sa Yaumul Qiyamah
english_translation: Life will pass by before meeting its end, and only one’s deeds (good or bad) will last forever.
interpretation:
Legacy is built on actions, not possessions.
→ A spiritual and moral reminder to live meaningfully.

meranaw_proverb: Benar man ka pipharinan so parabowat o tapar na da pen a ini kaog o adil-adil o lemba.
literal_translation_meranaw: Oway den ka kiya kawangan so bager o lawas na da maronot so pamikiran.
english_translation: The mind, unlike the physical body and its senses, is still active.
interpretation:
Mental and spiritual awareness can outlast physical decline.
→ Value of wisdom and mental strength with age.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den man madakel so pong na da' a mamalala on.
literal_translation_meranaw: Baden madakel a dato odi na kambata-bataa na da mala on i tindeg
english_translation: There are numerous leaders and relatives, but none of them can assist.
interpretation:
Status or numbers don’t guarantee help; true support is rare.
→ A lesson in self-reliance and discernment.

meranaw_proverb: Benar ka maito na kanengket a maidan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya maito a mama, na di ngka maphanigoro ka mabager a maongangen.
english_translation: Small but terrible (strong and intelligent).
interpretation:
Don’t underestimate someone based on size or appearance.
→ A teaching on valuing ability over looks.

meranaw_proverb: Karandaan so seleg na panempangen so rinaw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Ipagawa so gani ago rarangit na paki ngginawai ka
english_translation:
Be friendly and keep your fury, rage, and hatred under control or put them away. Rather than 
always being smart, try to be tranquil and pleasant.
interpretation:
Emotional restraint and kindness are better than showing off intellect.
→ A self-teaching on emotional intelligence and humility.

meranaw_proverb: Komlid si walowa na walo peman ka gantang
literal_translation_meranaw: Apiya antonaa den i showaan o taw a da a polos iyan na da den a pagisegan iyan.
english_translation:
An industrious man can not have more than what he is worth. A lazy person, on the other 
hand, has nothing to gain.
interpretation: Hard work doesn’t guarantee riches, but laziness guarantees nothing.

meranaw_proverb: O di ka mananamar a rambayong a khada-an na saken pen i pemboko a gadong a phaka kowa.
literal_translation_meranaw: O di ka phipiya-piya a miya metang na saken pen ay a bitangan.
english_translation:
If you won’t do good (man who paid the dowry), how much more for me (the lady who 
received the dowry)?
interpretation: Responsibility is shared; if the giver won’t act righteously, the receiver is in a more difficult position.

meranaw_proverb: Mipoon bo aki so moti ko karo-rombaan iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya andamanaya den na sii bo kha-roshang so taw ko lolot iyan
english_translation: A relative could still marry a relative no matter what one person did.
interpretation: Custom or fate can override individual feelings or objections.

meranaw_proverb: Ino ako di shantik ka palad ako komogit na mapiya so da mba-ok na kha-poonan a apoy
literal_translation_meranaw: Ino ako di gaid phamaba ka o kambaba-i ako na mapiya so di ron ped na ped on pen a kha-rarang
english_translation: I don't provoke because if I do, everyone will pay the consequences.
interpretation:
The speaker restrains themselves out of awareness of their own potential for destructive power.
→ A self-teaching on self-control and responsibility.

meranaw_proverb: llain ta so ped ta na di ta on mapaparo, na o siri-a ta niyan na di mambo maso-sorot.
literal_translation_meranaw: Oman aken mailay na pekha rarangitan ko, na ilain ako niyan na sakamaoto mambo a nggaganiyan ta niyan.
english_translation: I hate him and he hates me too.
interpretation: Acknowledging mutual resentment, possibly a warning about how hatred mirrors and multiplies.

meranaw_proverb: Mabaya motang ta na somgad mayad ta.
literal_translation_meranaw: Matao ta mang-otang na o sekati ta iran na pekha rarangitan ta
english_translation: I am used to ask for credit, but when asked for repayment, I got mad.
interpretation: Calls out hypocrisy and lack of accountability.

meranaw_proverb: Mangangako dansalan o an a mimbala iyan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Phangraw o aden a maka ogop on.
english_translation: He will only accept if someone will support.
interpretation: Some people depend on validation before committing.

meranaw_proverb: Mababaya bondakan si menda mabonda a ig.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mababaya komowa na di matao mamemegay.
english_translation: Wants to take, but refuses to give
interpretation: A warning against selfishness and imbalance in relationships or exchanges. True fairness involves mutual effort and generosity.

meranaw_proverb:
Aya masa gowani na rek aken so rek aken na rek ka so rek ka, na mini takap so masa na rek aken so rek aken na rekita so rek ka, na 
aya masa imanto na rek aken so rek aken na rek aken pen so reka.
english_translation:
At first, mine is mine and yours is yours, and for the second time, mine is mine and yours is 
ours, and for the third time, mine is mine and yours is mine.
interpretation: A critique of gradual exploitation masked as partnership. It teaches you to be cautious of manipulation that grows over time.

meranaw_proverb: Maolad kon so tinapi a di so tinapi-an on.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mala odi na mapiya so miyangilay sa kapiyaan a di so piyangilay a kapiyaan
english_translation: The family of the groom is more famous and powerful than the family of the bride.
interpretation: A commentary on social class and pride. While it might state a fact, it warns of how status can cloud humility and genuine connection.

meranaw_proverb: Minsan dowa so tothol na thomo so pariksa.
literal_translation_meranaw: So pekha sobagan sa bitiyara na pangamada ngka daan.
english_translation: Clarify the information that has two versions to get the truth.
interpretation: Encourages critical thinking and honest investigation. Don’t accept hearsay; verify.

meranaw_proverb: Mala-tinting i lalis si tagtek sa oriyan na tabalik sa onaan
literal_translation_meranaw: Tanto den a matanog i lalis odi na mangongoraw si da a khapasad iyan.
english_translation: It's only good for talking, but no work is done.
interpretation: Criticism of those who talk but never act. Morally, it's a push toward being action-oriented and dependable.

meranaw_proverb: Maroganday si olan ka maronok so milombay
literal_translation_meranaw: Mataid so wata a babay ka mataid so lokes iyan
english_translation: The daughter is beautiful because her mother is beautiful.
interpretation: A metaphor for inherited values or traits. Could be extended to mean: goodness (or flaws) in character often begin at home.

meranaw_proverb: Magiring sa kalodan so peshalangkap a danaw.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya matag koma-kalilid a taw na pephanangin sa mala.
english_translation: A commoner pretends to be royal.
interpretation: A lesson in humility and honesty. Pretending to be more than you are leads to eventual disgrace.

meranaw_proverb: Miyawa' da maipat ka shong sa matordo ron
literal_translation_meranaw: Miyondog na miyangiloba sa salakaw a khatapian on a mai-inengka on.
english_translation: When nobody from the group gave him recognition, he moved to another.
interpretation: Teaches self-worth. If you’re not valued in one place, it's okay to seek respect elsewhere. Don't let others define your worth.

meranaw_proverb: Mapapak so pakoring na so magolaleng peman.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapangka sa paganay so galbek na shasaromanan peman taman sa maka apas
english_translation: Failure on the first attempt, followed by success on the second attempt.
interpretation: A clear message of perseverance and learning from failure. Success often follows setbacks.

meranaw_proverb: So lalag i baronger na mashipa sangkol iyan
literal_translation_meranaw: So kambabari-wanger a galbek na mipsendit sa oriyan
english_translation: One’s disloyalty and insincerity at work will be repented by him in the end.
interpretation: Teaches accountability. If you work without honesty, you will face regret and consequences.

meranaw_proverb: Sa di maserseren na kitang a rek iyan on.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa den sa di maperes na da a khakowa niyan
english_translation: No one can achieve success unless they believe in themselves.
interpretation: Moral self-empowerment: success begins with inner belief and confidence.

meranaw_proverb: Sa di thamok sa banta na di maka ndatomanong, na sa di manganiyaya na di maped ko bolawan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
O di ka pananamokan sa piyamanekhaw odi na piyang-alampas na di ka maped ko bolawan a tamok.
Aya maana ini na di ka phananamokan sa bolawan o ba piyamanekhaw odi na piyang-aniyaya ka mipsendit ka ko 
kokoman o manosiya ago so kokoman o Allah SWT.
english_translation:
If the only option to get gold and silver is to steal and cheat, don't steal or cheat because you 
will be held accountable by the law and Allah SWT
interpretation: A direct moral and religious teaching on honesty and justice: material gain at the expense of ethics leads to divine and legal punishment.

meranaw_proverb:
An a sobra lawan a pephagasad-asaden na tiyago ko ladiya na da on bo maka peno, na tiyakes ko rataran na da on maka daladap, 
na tiyangel ko kaloda na da on pen maka peno, na tiyago ko saridot ka oba roron manda-it na da niyan pen marames.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Aden a taw a di den kao-onsran odi ambog ka maka lelebi kon ko langowan taman a di so manga 
ped iyan –na tepngan ko kanggalbek sa mapiya na da a miya paki ilay niyan odi na kenaba piyur a mapasang
english_translation: Pretenders claim to be the greatest of the best, but they can't afford to do a single good deed.
interpretation: Condemns boastfulness without action. True greatness is shown through deeds, not empty words.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i inambar o taw na aya den kalabo-an.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Sa den sa pinggalbek o taw na aya niyan den khailay sii sa Yaumul Qiyamah o mapiya na so Sorga, na o marata na so 
Naraka Jahannam.
english_translation:
What one has done determines how much he will earn—Paradise for good deeds, and hellfire 
for bad actions.
interpretation: Your afterlife is determined by your deeds—rewarded with Heaven or punished with Hell.

meranaw_proverb: Anda i piyamaroraw na aya kabarantanan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Sa den sa miya nggalbek ka marata antaa ka mapiya na khailay ngka den so pantag iyan
english_translation: What you've done (good or bad) will be rewarded correspondingly.
interpretation: You reap what you sow; divine justice is exact and fair.

meranaw_proverb: An a manik o an a manog.
literal_translation_meranaw: Aden a limo o aden a ini pangalimo.
english_translation: You will receive exactly what you offer
interpretation: Your actions reflect your worth and determine your fate, both in this life and the next.

meranaw_proverb: Mapiya pen bolawan i oran sa di ta inged na maphag-iroy ta den so tarintik sa ngganatan.
literal_translation_meranaw:
Mapiya i kapipiya ginawa, kaso-sorot, ago sokatan ko kena o ba ta inged na ngganatan ta bo ka pembalingan ta ko 
tithow a inged ta. Lagid o doniya a mapiya i kiya paka daya on o taw na mbaling bo sekaniyan sa Yaumul Qiyamah.
english_translation:
No matter how convenient or successful a foreign place is, there will come a time when it is 
time to return home. It will be the same as the Hereafter's home.
interpretation:
Just as one eventually returns home from distant lands, every soul must return to its eternal home—the afterlife. Earth is temporary; the Hereafter is 
permanent.

meranaw_proverb: Ba den man ari sagad so kintay na kakal so pimbasokan.
literal_translation_meranaw: So kawiyagoyag na baden sagad ko doniya na aya khatatap na so miya pasad a 'amal a di mipembelag o manosiya
english_translation: Life is too temporary, but one’s deeds (good or bad) are permanent.
interpretation: Life fades quickly, but your actions outlast you and define your legacy and your judgment.

meranaw_proverb: O migadong si ropa na aya den si ropindo.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya di maka dadarpa na katii ako.
english_translation: One is the other's alter ego
interpretation: This may reflect the duality of the self—perhaps the inner soul and the outward self, or the contrast between worldly self and spiritual self.

meranaw_proverb: Maolay bo so gadong na magendod sa ngganatan, na maronot so rambayong na mbaling sa tharikhodan.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya di matay a sakit so taw, na ngkaya den i kalokes iyan na magiyog sa magenda na magendod sa Yammul Qiyamah.
english_translation: It is possible that one will not die of illness, but rather of old age.
interpretation: Not all death comes from suffering—some comes quietly with time. The point is that death is inevitable.

meranaw_proverb:
Pagonayan so alam a sapolo rasay ta on na di ta maraw ganatan ka kina- layaman a dar, na dalsan so mahloq a siyaw sansara ta on a 
di maraw talikhodan ka pithagamanan a siri.
literal_translation_meranaw: Mapiya i karomasayan o manosiya ko doniya na di niyan kharawan gomanat.
english_translation:
Man is suffering from the violence of this world and yet does not want to leave it when asked. Or 
we try very hard even though it is difficult to improve ourselves, but in the end, everything will 
end when death claims you. The world is deceiving, but it is difficult to give up.
interpretation:
We suffer in this world, yet cling to it. We strive to become better despite hardship, but death ends all struggle. The world offers illusions, yet we resist 
letting go.
